Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam is great!”
Reviews.Author: Didi1962
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip to Amsterdam and enjoyed our stay. The Hotel Amsterdam - De Roode Leeuw is in the center and very well located. We can really recommend it. If we travel to Amsterdam again, this hotel will be our accommodation again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Pistolpjh
Reviews.Content: I had a weekend off during a 3 week European business trip and choose this hotel based on price (under $200) and location. It is about 700 metres from Central Station and right off of Dam Square. When I booked the room I requested a room facing Damrak and when I checked in I was extremely pleased as the room was recently remodeled, was large by European standards for a standard room and was very quiet considering it faced a major street. When I checked in I mentioned two things to the front desk staff: First that I had been sick and was interested in finding a doctor and second that i needed to do 10 days worth of laundry. By the time I got to my room they were calling to let me know that they had a doctor who would come to the hotel after 5pm for 125 Euros or I could walk there (15 minutes) and it would be 50 Euros. As i was leaving to walk to the doctor they gave me a map of a place around the corner that would wash, dry and fold my laundry for 17.50 Euros. I have to say that the staff at this hotel were friendly, cheerful and went out of their way to help me and I am extremely grateful. For what you pay for this hotel, combined with the location and the staff, this hotel is a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not picturesque but very central.”
Reviews.Author: Bubblegum5131
Reviews.Content: Good location, central to main attractions. On arrival, Virginia greeted us and checked us in. Very friendly, quick and efficient. We had a smoking room and it was as expected. Quite small, tiny bathroom but clean. Tea and coffee making facilities aren't the best. Room was tired, dated and old looking however hotel lobby was nice. Mediocre at its best but clean.. However after a certain time at night you have to be buzzed in the hotel lobby, and it was heavily raining and we were ringing the door buzzer almost continually for a good ten minutes. No body was on the front desk. We didn't even get a apology! Much friendlier staff in the day rather than night. Make sure you visit Anne Frank's house, and some McDonalds charge for using toilets!!! Shocking! (even when you've eaten there)

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Misscotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in March and I couldn't fault it! Perfect location, room clean and tidy, mini bar was well stocked and a smoking room! Staff were attentive and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wmccorma
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with friends. Best location in Amsterdam. Close to all services and attractions. Staff were great. Quiet and comfortable. Rooms small(ish) but acceptable. Best value I found in Amsterdam. Definitely will use this hotel again if I visit Amsterdam. well done and keep up the great value and quality

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Expat_in_UK113
Reviews.Content: Great location in Amsterdam, short walk from the train station (maybe 0.5 miles), right next to Dam Square, and just outside of the Red Light District. Room was easily big enough for 2 people, was clean, beds were comfortable, and no problems with the temp in the room! Our room was located on the side facing Damrak street, with a busy road we figured we'd hear something from out there, but overnight we couldn't hear anything. We could hear some of the other people in the hotel shutting doors and such, but not a big deal. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, as we wanted to explore the city streets and find a pancake!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to see Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: helenawesome
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 3 night stay in Amsterdam. we booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews. the location is right beside dam square and just 700 m from central station. it is a perfect location for people who are travelling to tour and view Amsterdam. the staff at reception are very helpful and efficient. the rooms are on the small side but very comfortable but then we were not there to sit in the hotel all day. there was both smoking and non smoking rooms. the rooms were cleaned everyday and the facilities were modern. it had a a mini bar and kettle with tea and coffee available. the beds were very comfortable and in total this hotel met all the reviews that had been written. thank you Hotel Amsterdam for a lovely city break. you deserve your good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdOT
Reviews.Content: I booked online just before Christmas and got a good deal for me and my mate to stay for two nights in Amsterdam. The hotel looked to be recently renovated and the room we were offered was very clean, modern and spacious. The en suite bathroom was also modern and was very clean. The room had a mini bar, television, safe, European and English plug sockets (which was lucky as I'd forgotten my adapter) and air conditioning. The location of the hotel could not have been better, situated right next to Dam Square within 5 minutes walk of Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “check it out!!”
Reviews.Author: rodtrishmcb
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights, Great location- walking distance from rail station , room (after upgrade) large, staff very helpful and knowledgeable. Room quiet Be careful with eating in the attached restaurant Lovely meal but we paid cash and we were also billed on credit card. It was sorted out quickly as we were remembered but could be problematic if long period had passed.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite spot on...”
Reviews.Author: The_new_Mrs_Hey
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love De Roode Leeuw having read earlier reviews, but we didnâ€™t get off to a good start. I had booked the hotel through Otel.com for a cheap 3 night break and requested a smoking room. I arrived at around half 12pm with my husband and we were able to check straight in, which was nice. Not so nice, was the fact that it would cost 45 euros extra for a smoking room which had not been mentioned at the time of booking! Fair enough I thought, Otel should make this clear, they probably charge extra for cleaning the rooms. When we got into the room though, the smell of stale smoke was overwhelming, topped off by sickly mint air freshener. There were scuff marks to the walls, the kettle didnâ€™t work and the bottom of the mini bar was dirty. All in all, it felt a bit neglected. We left our bags and went out for some lunch, but on returning a couple of hours later the smell was just unbearable. I went to reception to ask if we could switch to a non-smoking room, but very conveniently there were no double rooms available. In the end I chose to upgrade to a superior room for an extra 75 euros, as we would have had to pay the 45 anyway! All of the reception staff were friendly and helpful, speaking excellent English, and I was able to view the superior room before committing. I must say the superior room was lovely, having recently been refurbished. It was twice the size of the standard room, with a great view and a bath â€“ which really swung it for me. On a couple of minor points, the TV was rather too far away from the very comfortable bed (good selection of channels though) and there was no decently lit mirror for applying make-up. A definite plus was the hair dryer â€“ so hard to get right in a hotel! It was definitely worth the extra, but was an additional expense we had not accounted for, and donâ€™t forget the city tax either! We didnâ€™t eat at the hotel, finding 15 euros a bit steep for a buffet breakfast, but the restaurant did look busy at all times of the day. Overall although the stay was pleasant enough, I found the hotel to be lacking atmosphere â€“ with a very small â€˜motel-ishâ€™ reception and no bar area, and I would probably choose somewhere a bit more homely if I was to visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: dean00_0
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, rooms pokey but ok. Had uk tv channels like bbc1! Very refreshing shower, good selection of mini bar lol Now for the location.... It's as central as you can get! Restaurant downstairs has good food too Stop here for a treat, you won't regret it

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - good and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: a_167
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night break in Jan 2012. The main selling point is the location - right in the middle of everything and around 5-10 mins from the centraal station. We were upgraded to a recently renovated junior suite which was lovely and had a large balcony looking over the damtrak (but not too noisy as double glazing etc). The front desk service was very helpful and flexible, especially the blonde girl (I cant remember her name unfortunately). Only downside was breakfast which was average at best (â‚¬15).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cyberlady
Reviews.Content: De Roode Leeuw hotel in Amsterdam was an really nice hotel at perfect location within walking distance from many imprtant places like Madame TussaudÂ´s, Anne Frank Museum and also the Red Light District. Staff were really friendly and room totally adequate, a bit drafty but ok. Breakfast was good but a bit inadequate for 15 euros. I still would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Cappilla
Reviews.Content: Hi! we just got back from a splendid 7 days stay at this place and have nothing but most positive impressions from it! we were kindly upgraded to a Superior room,which wasn't spacious but still functional, well organized, with enough cabinet space - which is always important to me, and at the same time very cosy and comfortable. speaking of comfort - that bed !!! no exaggeration, the softest, most wonderful bed and beddings, for which i'm still longing... great location,indeed, in the heart of all the action, and close to all popular sight seeings. the staff is attentive and friendly, and the house-keeping - immaculate. thanks for everything and we will be back! p.s. you may consider putting a shower curtain or glass in the bathroom to prevent the water from splashing all over the floor :)

Reviews.Title: “Short Break”
Reviews.Author: shane w
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights in the begining of December , staff were friendly and welcoming on arrival , room was adequate as we knew thew were refurbishing the rooms , but it is only for sleeping in . Close to the Dam Square and all ameneties

Reviews.Title: “Please don't waste your time and money here. There are much better and inexpensive options nearby on Dam Square.”
Reviews.Author: hello123Jk
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in beginning of December 2011 for 4 nights. First of all, this hotel just sucks. It is extremly expensive for the quality and price they charge and the services they provide. It is an old hotel in an old and outdated building built in 1913. The weekend I was there for they claimed they were charging 260 Euros a night! (outragious. I believe there should be some sort of regulations on these kind of thuggery as they charge what they want).The first floor is under renovation. We were put up in a so called superior room ( a blatant joke) on the 2nd floor and for all the price we payed, I could hear all their construction jazz and jack hammers in our room. When asked to be put to a different room, all I heard was that they are sold out and the 2nd floor is the only floor they have superior rooms on. Their front desk has no etiquettes. Their night person named ' Prashant' should get a job somehere as a club gatekeeper or something like that as he lacks basic talking manners and is plane 'rude' and so is there other lady who works in the mornings (sofina). Their so called manager 'Virginia" is no better either. If you have any differences with them or if you tell them that you want a different room or comment on their services, they do not wanna talk to you. They would just ignore you. This lady Sofina or safina ( can't recall her name correctly) told me one morning that she can't talk to me about an issue with my room billing charges as she was very busy (though the front desk was empty and had no guests that she was tending to at that time). Their rooms are really small and cramped (even their so called superior rooms). Their hallways are real narrow. I could hear the foot step noises from the guests above my floor and the coughing of the other guests next door very clearly. Their TVs are a shame (real small). Their bathrooms have absolutely no space. Everything is crodwed and stuffed in their little bathrooms. The toilet seat is in a corner with no space to sit and something hanging above your head. Their bathroom sinks are small and so is their bathtub which is shielded by a half size glass partition and the water just sparkles on the bathroom floor when you shower. The heating in rooms takes forever to start (15 min or so- they claim the hot air comes from a different pipe systems) and the temp would claim to go upto 28 degree celsius but you would be freezing all night in cold Amsterdam winter weather. The hotels in the vicinity are much less inexpensive. The hotel Kransnaplosky's room rate right acroos the square was 100 Euros a night with all the basic services as this hotel provided. Hotel Doria was charging 80 Euros a night and another bigger hotel nearby (can't remember the name was charging only 120 Euros a night). What a rip off. I even saw 4 star hotels being advertirsed for the same weekend being charged at 120-130 Euros a night onnly. The only nice thing about this hotel is it's location. If you don't want to be ripped off and want better value for your money, there are plenty of nicer and much inexpensive options in the vicinity. O, please don't believe on their website propaganda and all the praises they shower on themselves. Hopeless place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break”
Reviews.Author: katrina o
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel.... Fantastic location, just 5 minute walk from the station, and local to everything. Rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are really comfortable, they are abit small, but big enough for a couple. Food is fantastic. The staff are the most helpfull and friendly i've ever come across, really nothing is too much trouble, n they are always smiling and polite. Had a fantastic and most relaxing break here. Brilliant!!! To the manager... Thank you for making our break so enjoyable, your staff are a credit to your lovely hotel, we will deffinately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the terrible rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AlistairRobertson61
Reviews.Content: It's a pity that my abiding memory of the Red Lion is of the terrible rooms. Because in all other areas this smallish hotel is rather good. It occupies a spendid location on the Damrak immediately next to Dam square and well placed for pretty much all of the cities main sites.The main Tram Lines run past the front door and it is also no more than a ten minute trolly-case drag to and from the Railway station.The staff were(with one exception) unfailingly polite and helpful. The restaurant is quite upmarket and pricey but there is no seperate bar and so I felt as if we were imposing on the diners paying top dollar when we were using it as a bar or briefly for a coffee.And so to the accomodation! The rooms are small as you would expect in Amsterdam.But they are also in drastic need of rennovation (which to be fair is starting to happen).But in the meantime you will find your room to be badly and cheaply furnished with uncomfortable beds and a bathroom so narrow that, to be indelicate,requires some flexibility in your angle of attack to use the critical facilities. And so i would summarise thus.The Red Lion is a fabulous little hotel until you open your bedroom door. We may return in the future when the rennovations are completed but as these are evidently being done by the staff themselves maybe I shouldn't hold out much hope.Perhaps by the time we return we will have saved up enough to stay at the Barbizon Palace which is so so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service! (detailed review)”
Reviews.Author: Auzeen
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking any hotels we were looking for a big bathroom, good location and affordable. Great thing about Tripadvisor is that you can see the photographs that other's have taken. I read about how small the rooms were and how some bathrooms comes with a shower or a tub. I contacted De Roode Leeuw regarding this and they got back to me the following day assuring they can provide a room with a tub (for my fairly large sized husband). After I booked the Superior room, they emailed me again with positive feed back for taking the larger room and assured that we will be very happy for our week's stay. This was very comforting. We arrived at about 11am and the room was not yet ready but they took our luggage and advised us to wait 2-3 hours. Luckily there were lots to do in the area so we had something to eat then walked around for a bit. We came back at 1pm and the room was ready. The room (202) was, in my opinion, Superior as said. There were 2 twin beds pushed together with clean sheets and pillows and side by side tables. I am a religious hunter for bed bugs and I am very happy to say there were none. Even behind the beds were dust free. A wardrobe with a few shelves (we had to move the coffee and liquor around to make room). 2 chairs with a middle table (looked old but I take it in that it's not necessary to update the furniture if it's not broke). A desk with a chair (this is where we charged our electronic devices). 2 Balconies and 2 Windows with long curtains or drapes (I live like a vampire and like my room dark and the drapes really helped with that). The view was of direction towards the monument and the street with the department store across. With the drapes open the room was very bright and open. A heater (the heat didn't go very far but it kept the room survivable). A TV with a few local channels and a few channels in English A mini bar, but we were able to store our water in there at least. 2 separate bathrooms: Very modern looking and I loved how the floor was not cold when you stepped on it. One bathroom was long with a sink and a toilet. There's no window but there is a small fan. I recommend bringing an air freshener for the big loads, lol. The other was L shaped with a sink, tub and a separate shower. I absolutely loved the tub that I took a bath twice! I don't even take baths at home. There's a window far up that you can open and close with a stick that is hidden in the corner. The shower has no door so you will get some water going around the floor but just place a towel right next to it and the rest of it will dry up quickly. The room also offers a pair of slippers which helps keep your feet dry. The sizes of both bathrooms were generous and definitely worth the upgrade to the Superior rooms. The room also provided (but we didn't use), a coffee/tea machine, safe and air conditioner. The carpet was dark but looked fairly clean. From what I remember, there were a few stains but how can you expect a carpet to stay clean when you have thousands of guests per year. It was very satisfied with the cleanliness of the room. I have read in other reviews about the noise coming from the streets. Yes, there is a tram stop right in front of the hotel that go by every 2 minutes during the day and some during the night and, of course, the sound of the thousands of residents and tourists that walk by but we got used to it after the first day. There was construction in the floor beneath us but we were informed upon arrival and the sawing and drilling didn't usually happen until the late morning in which by then you shouldn't be in the hotel room but you should be out and exploring the city!! While looking for restaurants to add to the itinerary, I came across the De Roode Leeuw Restaurant a few times. It's a very popular spot as every time we walk by it's packed and it's recommended to make reservations. We tried the breakfast buffet and it was worth the 15euros. Lots of options and all kinds of drinks to choose from. The waitress was so nice and even recommended things to us. On the last 2 days we got incredibly sick and asked room service if it was possible to order from the restaurant because we didn't want to step foot outside. (There's a separate menu for room service FYI). They were very happy to accommodate that. Service was very nice. I mean don't expect them to give you the world on a silver platter and chat it up with you but they do their jobs. I wanted to call a restaurant to see what time they closed but I couldn't figure out how to use the phone in the room so I asked the front desk to call. They were very helpful with that. Housekeeping will stop you in the middle of the hall and ask if you need anything in your room to be refreshed. Check out was very informative. They explained how much of the deposit they took out and how much they will be keeping in detail and how much we will be getting back on the card right away. The best part of all was location. I could not believe how easy it was to walk everywhere we wanted. you were literally in the center of Amsterdam. From my previous Europe trip experience, I had always spread out my itinerary because I know it's hard to get a lot done in such a short period of time and all of Europe requires lots of walking. We were actually able to finish a week of things to do in just 4 days!! This is because of the location we had picked. Dam plaza and tourist shopping areas are right next to you. The trams goes to the major tourist spots, like the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. The centraal station is just a 10 minute walk away. Red light, 5 minutes away. The nine streets is right behind the hotel and takes you down to Leidseplein and the flower markets. Jordaan is 10 minutes away. Lots of restaurants near by. It was also good for times when it started raining pretty badly. We were able to just run back to the hotel for a few hours and then come back out once the sky cleared up. The first few days we were pretty jet lagged and it was good to go out during the morning, come back to take an afternoon nap, then out again for the night. Safe area too! It's just overall the most perfect location. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and if I ever do go back to Amsterdam, I am staying here and will try anything to ask for room 202 again. lol. I am sorry if my review is more of a novel. I just really want to show future guests that this is a great hotel and you'll have a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: okamalo
Reviews.Content: Few steps from transportation, few steps from shopping area, few steps from red light, right on the Dam sq. , rooms are not big, but clean, free wireless internet what else do you need? Compared to other hotels, the value for money is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wet and Windy but great fun”
Reviews.Author: Auburnaura
Reviews.Content: We spent a very pleasant week in Amsterdam staying at this hotel, the only drawback being the very wet and windy weather. This hotel is ideally situated within walking distance of all the major attractions in Amsterdam. Hotel staff were more than happy to help and nothing was too much trouble for them. A very pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round!”
Reviews.Author: Bris_ChrisF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our annual winter city break and with only 3 nights, we wanted somewhere in the vicinity of De Dam. We have stayed several times in Amsterdam now and are used to the variable standard of hotels here. The Hotel Amsterdam is definitely a gem of a find. Having arrived at the tram stop directly outside the hotel, we received a genuinely warm welcome from the reception staff. We had booked a superior room as we wanted a step up from basic. We were pleasantly surprised that because my wife and I were celebrating an anniversary we had been upgraded to what I imagine is one of their junior suites. It was huge with a recently refurbished bathroom containing both bath and separate shower, separate en-suite lavatory and a seating area. The amount of space was phenomenal, occupying a corner of the hotel building with full length balcony doors facing almost onto the Dam Square. However with double glazing none of the street noise ever bothered us and the distant 'ding ding' of the trams outside only added to the great Amsterdam atmosphere we love. The bed was comfortable if a little firm but we slept well. Unlike other reviewers, we did not experience any problems with the 'open' shower cubicle in the bathroom. By using some common sense, flooding of the floor was easily avoided. The bathroom itself was beautifully done out in a contemporary style with fantastic underfloor heating. My only criticism is that because of the large sink, I found using the mirror to shave was a problem but this was a very monorail inconvenience. I came equipped with an iPad and iPhone but could easily keep connected via the wi-fi in the room which was surprisingly speedy considering it was free. The room was spotless and miraculously had regained the same condition on our return to the hotel each afternoon! My requests for wi-fi passwords, an extra blanket and even clarification of the thermostat use were met with the same faultless pleasant response from the reception staff. We could not underestimate the excellent service we received even down to the cheery hello and goodbye as left and returned to the hotel each day. As with all hotel breakfasts in Amsterdam, the price was more than you pay in most of the cafes around the city, so as usual we chose to find a little 'hoek' by a canal to watch the world go by. Therefore I cannot comment on the quality of breakfast offered at the hotel. We came to the hotel with certain expectations, but found these had been far surpassed. I understand that the reat of the rooms are all currently being refurbished and if ours was anything to go by then I am sure the rest will not disappoint. One last note which has really impressed me and is indicative of the standard we found on our visit here at the end of November - the manager has responded to every comment placed on here. This clearly shows that the management are interested in what the customers think at the end of the day. Keep up the good work! We look forward to a return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissTwizz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was right on Dam square and we were not disappointed by the location. We were however quite disappointed with the room. The price for this hotel is a little on the high side and this must be because of the location because the quality of the rooms definitely donâ€™t reflect the price. Our room was very cramped and our bathroom also very small â€“ just a shower with no bath which is a shame. This however wasnâ€™t much of a problem for us as we spent very little time in the hotel and still had a lovely holiday. I thought it might be useful to mention our experience because if room size and comfort are more important to you, you may want to think twice about this hotel or pay extra for one of their suites which I assume will be bigger. The staff were very nice and helpful throughout our stay. We asked advice, directions etc on a number of occasions and staff were polite, helpful and very knowledgeable. We did not try the restaurant. It looked nice from the outside but the prices seemed rather high and we found loads of places nearby that did wonderful food for more reasonable prices. In conclusion, prices on the high side but fantastic location. If a big comfortable room is top of your list maybe think twice about this hotel and there is lovely food available in the area for more reasonable prices than the hotel restaurant offers. Location couldnâ€™t be better, fantastic base for exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AceV
Reviews.Content: I stayed here couple of months ago. The hotel staff are very friendly. The hotel is situated strategically. The double room was very clean. The bathroom is really classy. I definitely recommend this hotel. Visiting Amsterdam and staying at this hotel was really a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Einat G
Reviews.Content: This hotel located on the Dam squrare the most importent spot at Amsterdam, Basically this hotel is average not more then that.... The the room was very tiny 12 feet !!!! and the price was a little bit higher then other hotels... Conclusions: if this is your first time at Amsterdam, this hotel will be a good choice for you. if not and u already know the city, there are better hotels with lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Greta G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here about a month ago for a 5 day vacation. We checked out many hotels online and settled on this place because it had the best location for the money. This is a boutique hotel that is right off the bustling Dam Square. You can walk to practically anywhere in the city and there are a ton of bars all around. The hotel itself is just okay thought. But the hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. Since we were staying for 5 days they "upgraded" us to a bigger room (still had the two twin beds pushed together) - but as you know all hotel rooms in Europe are small so I'd hate to see what the other size was! The room also had a weird smell - like a musty wet smell - even bought Febreze to try to get rid of it to no avail. If they would replace the carpet and do a fresh coat of paint it would help a lot. But the bathrooms have been updated which is great, but the shower is small and there is no shower door which is a little strange and water gets all over the floor (perhaps the source of the weird smell?). There is a big grocery store called Albert Heijn only a block away which is awesome but strangely they don't accept credit cards. Would I stay here again? Probably not - would pay a little more and try to stay at the Swiss Hotel next door since it's nicer. But again if you're looking for an "affordable" hotel (by European standards anyway) in an ideal location and can deal with it not being super nice then maybe this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Professional and Central”
Reviews.Author: spikey2
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the De Roode Leeuw by now more than 10 times. That should tell enough! The rooms range from tiny to seriously big if you take a suite (which we did the last 2 times) - the regular small rooms come as a bit of a shock if you have not stayed in a hotel in Amsterdam before, but are adequate I find. The Hotel is located very central, we often just take the train from the Airport to 'Centraal Station' and then walk down to the hotel with our luggage. Rooms are tidy, and clean, the bathrooms adequate (great if compared with American Hotel bathrooms), the staff is friendly and helpful. De Rooe Leuw has our vote

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beachmom
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights the first week of April. It was the perfect location. We loved being able to look out our window and see all of the action on Dam square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived early and we were able to check in as soon as we got there. The room was small but it was all we needed and was comfortable. We had no trouble with the free wifi. We ate in the restaurant one evening and really enjoyed our Dutch meal. Our waiter was great and made it fun. My youngest daughter is attending grad school in Amsterdam and will be there for the next two years so I look forward to staying here again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in heart of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ninadhir
Reviews.Content: From reading others reviews, we paid a little more for a superior room so that we could have the extra space. The room is very big. It comes with a king bed, tv, free internet using ethernet, mini fridge, kettle, coffee maker and nice bathroom. Our bathroom had a wood door on it, but the shower is funny -- it's got glass part of the way so it floods the bathroom floor. Not a big deal though. Front desk is nice and the hotel is right in the center of town - the perfect place to go exploring. I didn't try the restaurant because it looked expensive, but there are tons of places nearby to grab breakfast, lunch and dinner and a small grocery store for things to bring back to your room. Note: The hotel book in the room says there is a strict policy against bringing any food back to the hotel and there's no room to put things in the fridge because of what the hotel already offers. They also claim they will throw out any food they see that does not belong to them, so we got around that by never having the room serviced. The room is quiet -- the double pane soundproof windows are great, and they receive a lot of english channels. Overall a good place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Overall I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmilinaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. If you are not used to a lot of bustle outside a hotel, you may want to opt for a hotel on one of the canals and out of the way. The room was comfortable. It took a bit to get used to the glass door on the bathroom. My only complaint is that the Internet access was rather expensive. There only two packages are daily and business. The both are rather expensive if to be used only for email. The breakfast was very good

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mamsquill
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, right down the street from Central Staation and close to Dam Square. They were very accomadating giving us 2 rooms next to each other so our 15 year old twins would be close. It was air conditioned and had a mini fridge in the room. They even let us check in at 1pm since we arrived early and were exhausted from the trip. My only complaint would be the small bathrooms. They were very modern and clean but extremely small. The employees at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Suitcase_Packer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights recently on a long weekend break to Amsterdam. The hotel is conveniently located for the train station (10 minute walk) tram stops and many of the main sites. Rooms are on the small side, but you don't go to Amsterdam to stay in your room. The bathroom was modern with a good walk in shower. Rooms are probably best suited to close couples - with a frosted glass door between the toilet and bedroom - which does not hide much. We didn't eat at the hotel - lots of restaurants and bars around Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Yveschayeb
Reviews.Content: We Really enjoyed it, an exceptional experience in the heart of dam square ... I'm sure we'll be back ....

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: maryCyprus
Reviews.Content: we stayed at de roode leeuw hotel for 5 nights beginning of August 11. The hotel has an excellent location just in Dam Sq, with all the caffes and restaurants just a few minutes away. We bokked the smoking room on the 4th floor and it was really great. It was big enough for both of us,the mattress was comfortable and we had 24 hours hot water. The hotel staff is really helpful and willing to assist you to many questions. Amsterdam is really a very nice city worth viisiting!!!! We definitely go back and of course stay in the same room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of everything, beware of the room tax”
Reviews.Author: Inscribe
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy being in the centre of everything you will find that this hotel is only a few short steps away from Dam Square. Although the rooms are tiny and airless without the window being open they are quiet and peaceful if you get a room to the rear. Check-in was fast. The bed is a reasonable size and is comfortable but the bathroom has an almost transparent glass door. The television is situated awkwardly and cannot really be viewed from the bed. There is a room safe. There is a fire esacpe located directly outside the window which is reassuring. There is a room tax that they will hit you with at the end of your stay which is in addition to the cost of the room. I thought this was a bit much as I had paid in advance and no one had mentioned this extra fee. They said it wasn't for them, but something imposed by the municipal authorities. Nevertheless I felt I should have been informed about this when I was booking. Security is good as the hotel opens right onto the main street. Access to the lift is via a key card. The reception area is immediately in front of the lift. There is a seating area in the lobby which itself is small. But small can be beautiful too. The staff were knowledgable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to be in the middle of it all, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: evy44044
Reviews.Content: Checked in from Saturday, Aug. 13 checked out Tuesday, Aug. 16. The hotel is a short 10 min walk from the Centraal station. We arrived in pouring rain and still made the walk with all our luggage with no problem. The staff is super friendly and helpful and it was well worth the $190 a night. The hotel in a few feet from Dam Square and walking distance to everything in Amsterdam. The room itself was tiny (comparable to a small NYC hotel room) but that was expected...give up size for location. The bathroom was clean, newly renovated and super modern and the beds were comfy and clean. If this hotel is in your budget I recommend booking it. We came accross a problem with our american outlet converters/adapters. Make sure to buy the round ones or else the body of the adapter wont fit into the wall, im not talking about the prongs but the entire body of the converter needs to be a certain size and shape.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again on our next trip to amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gemma s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel amsterdam for a short midweek break. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were nice and clean and you couldn't ask for a better location. We stayed in a non-smoking room, but could smell smoke on the curtains. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but there are thousands of food shops nearby. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: matshanssen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amsterdam is located on Damrak, just a stone throw from Dam Square. In other words - great location. They have a restaurant with michelin star, absolutely worth a try! For the hotel itself, the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are pretty good, but I can imagine the glass doors to the toilet/shower can be a little bothersome for friends traveling together. For a couple its not that big deal, but if you like to keep your toilet visits private, then this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Enigmaticvampire
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... There is the tram station just in front... Near on yout left uou have got nice potato chips great to eat...a muncheese shop for sweets... Shopping center...on the right in the damrack the place to be... There are always people in there...near madam tissaud... And behind you have it all in the street shops food whatever.. Its greatly located... Specially if u dnt have a sense of orientation its great... Coffee near macdo near in any case....

Reviews.Title: “Good option in the best location”
Reviews.Author: BjÃ¸rn F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the superior room. It was spacious and well cleaned. The breakfast buffet was good, although somewhat limited in its selection.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastFee
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in fantastic location, it is situated so close to Dam Square that we thought it may be noisy but was very quiet and peaceful. Very clean room and bathroom. few TV channels in english which was good. The room was very warm though with thick blankets, however it cooled slightly when air con was on. The room was small - ish but it didnt bother us, we were mostly exploring Amsterdam. The only bad thing about the room is the see-through bathroom doors, but luckily we saw the funny side, however might be a bit awkward for friends /family visiting! Overall the stay was enjoyable and it was nice to have a hotel so near to the centre of amsterdam. This is my 4th time in amsterdam and if i return we will more than likely look at staying at Roode Leeuw again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the little brdrooms!”
Reviews.Author: skindiverDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 28th July 2011 to 1st August 2011. To be fair, the location was perfect. We were right in the heart of the 'must see' tourist area, 100 meters from Dam Square and 5/6 minutes walk from Central Station. The little bedroom was really cramped and that was uncomfortable. However, it was clean and the hotel staff & reception were very friendly and helpful. We were on B&B basis and breakfast was very nice, with all that you would want, served in a buffet style, as is normal these days. On a four-day trip to a city like Amsterdam, we wanted to spend as much time as possible out of the room, seeing the sights and soaking in the atmosphere, (you can get high, doing that!) so I suppose the size of the room was not as important as it might be on a longer holiday. Despite being in the centre, the double glazing worked and we were not disturbed by noise outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: makila10
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for a better local. Descent, clean room. I consider myslf very smart but the tv remote was impossible! Clean room but not luxury!

Reviews.Title: “convenient but very busy”
Reviews.Author: newtravellerdan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and had a superb room with a wonderfully big bed and comfy pillows, however for those wanting a break from the business of london or paris, it is not the ideal location. The staff were friendly, their English was wonderful and the food nearby plentiful. However, be aware that if you book through their website, it is only a guarantee of payment and you will be required to pay the full amount upon departure. It is a little tricky as it does disappear from your bank balance initially, only to return when you aren't looking! There are many local cafes, restaurants, canals and other sites to make your trip memorable and all within easy walking distance. In addition, you can almost see the train station from your hotel so the trip is within easy walking distance, even with heavy bags. It is in a very busy area though, so if you are hoping for an early night, forget it! The windows are quite good at limiting sound, however your hotel neighbours may let you down strolling in at all hours! Overall, I would stay here again. It's very convenient and the problems with noise are far outweighed by the comfortable bed and location!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a mixed bag - good and bad!”
Reviews.Author: easyodds
Reviews.Content: i booked a double but had to take a single when i arrived - it was the smallest room i have ever seen in my entire life (see piccie) - too awful and very expensive. the double for the second night was perfectly respectful but it wasn't a good experience overall breakfast was awful value but nice fresh produce - what there was of it !!!!! customer service was not friendly either avoid

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DirkDeMe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, if possible as for one of the 2 rooms on the top floor. I believe they're more spacious than the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: experimentaltraveler
Reviews.Content: My most important factors in selecting a hotel are location, safety, cleanliness and cost. De Roode hits the mark on all of these. Perfect location (walking distance from Central Station and one block from a tram station). Hotel is safe (front door security 24/7, on a main street with lots of restaurants and traffic). Clean, with especially nice bathrooms. Good value for what you get...free internet included. Rooms are adequate, but there's so much to do in Amsterdam that you only need to sleep there. Front office staff are very friendly and helpful. Go. Stay. Enjoy. Breakfast is good, not great. You can try it if it's convenient for you, but you can find good breakfasts all around the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but not quite 4* standard”
Reviews.Author: CousinJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as part of a package (so I can't really comment on price or value for money). We expected a 4* hotel with 4* service. We had a nice-enough hotel, but not quite up to what I expect from a 4*. The good bits. Very centrally located, almost on Dam Square. Very friendly and helpful staff Clean Our room was large, quiet, and had a large modern bathroom. The not-quite-so-good bits. Some of the hotel is looking tired and more than a bit dated. The lift (singular) is small and slow, and is also used by the staff to transport supplies. The beds and bedding also seem a bit tired. Not dirty/lumpy, just not quite as good as they should be. The lighting in the bathroom was poor. The staff do their best but seem overworked. One person on the front desk to check people in and out, answer the phone, answer guest queries, and deal with with walk-in enquiries. They work hard! Breakfast is not wonderful. If you come in towards the end of the breakfast time the choice may be limited. Again overworked staff may be part of the problem. And the slowest toaster in the world !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BobB53
Reviews.Content: Delightful and most helpful staff. Hotel itself rather old fashioned but perfectly good enough for a city break. Just off the Dam Square with trams stopping in front and behind the hotel make this an excellent centre from which to tour Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel...will always stay there in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gary1968_11
Reviews.Content: Its very close to the city, has some smoking rooms, its a quite nice building and service, rooms,...are absolutely ok...our yearly weekend in amsterdam is always in this nice hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a location that can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: kengj
Reviews.Content: We had a larger, corner room at the back of the hotel which was delightful. Street noise was not a problem. The single elevator is rather slow. Staff very friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend the hotel's restaurant. Also the department store right across the street (de Bijenkorf) is a great source of gifts etc. It has an excellent buffet style restaurant with a huge and delicious selection of foods at numerous stations.

Reviews.Title: “Still love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cath_Ian6480
Reviews.Content: After last years perfect stay at De Roode Loeeuw we went back for my 31st birthday, and we were just as pleased! We got a smaller room, but it was clean, cosy and with a nice view to the street and Dam Square. We were late up in the mornings, but found clean towels by the door every day. Nice big bed, the bathroom was small but not too small for what we needed it for - toilet, shower and sink. The first morning the water pressure felt a bit poor, but it only got better during the stay. The room also have a kettle, which is highly valued by us tea-at-all-times drinking people. We decided to stay another night, like we did last year, and got the same room without any problems. The staff is excellent, very friendly and helpful. Even when we come ringing the bell at 3-4 at nigt there is nothing but a smile :) The day we checked out we were offered to leave our bags while we went for breakfast, and picked them up just before we were heading for the train. We now call this "our hotel in Amsterdam" and will be coming back as long as there is birthdays to celebrate. Thank you for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: hazy_amersham
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right by Dam Square, tram stop directly in front of the hotel. The room we were first offered was not to our liking, rather small with no view (307) but we were moved with no problem to a corner room overlooking Damrak - room 301 is a good room ask for it! This hotel does what it says on the tin, management is good, client facing staff are good, housekeeping works (a little in your face sometimes but hard not to be in a compact building), breakfast is good. Beds are comfortable, WIFI free. Decoration is clean and tidy but will perhaps need to be revisited in a year or two after this season (2011) - lifting carpet edges, cracked surfaces. The one lift needs patience but steep stairs makes the wait worthwhile. Double-glazing does work to minimise sound problems but Damrak and Dam Sq are busy areas dont expect silence.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gokulram_Arunasalam
Reviews.Content: Gokulram Arunasalam We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Like other Amsterdam hotels, this too is small but the room has the basics (tv, mini bar, safe), the property is very clean and safe, the staff are extremely friendly and the location is top notch. Close to the tourist attractions, the main central station and the tram stop. The breakfast buffet is also very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “greatest hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregmisty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and loved every minute of it. The hotel is beautiful. clean and the staff is very friendly. We upgraded to a larger room and it was worth every penny. The bed was fantastic! The hotel is located in primo spot. You are near all the fun parts of town. I would stay there again and again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: ferry41
Reviews.Content: Room was OK, though there were problems with the bathroom design in that water ran out of the shower area into the rest of the bathroom. Chair was very wobbly with loose armrest. Staff was friendly and breakfast was good with selection of breads etc. The location is very central as it is near the Dam square. Good location for shopping in the Bijenkorf Department store (which is across the street). The street is a bit seedy but very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tyler12
Reviews.Content: My partner & i found this hotel to be very nice. It's in a good central location within easy walking distance of Central Station. The staff were very welcoming & friendly. We had a smoking room which did smell but i guess this is to be expected - just wish housekeeping would keep the windows open between guests so allow some of the smell to go away....but then they'd prob have ppl complaining about that. We paid approx Â£110 per night over a weekend, which is a bit steep compared to the quality we'd get at home but i think average for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Babyroo1971
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days recently to celebrate my 40th birthday. Upon arrival, we found the reception staff most friendly; even wishing me a Happy Birthday!! The room was clean and the bathroom extremely luxurious. Reception staff were very helpful and even gave us directions to places of interest. We did encounter a problem with hot water one day and a broken keyboard for internet use, but within 5 minutes of us alerting reception, the Bell Boy and Manager were on hand to help solve the problem. An early alarm call and even booking our taxi to the airport made our return home stress-free. Thank you to everyone who made our stay one we will remember for ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rhooseboy
Reviews.Content: We stopped for 3 nights and would certainly return. The positives - Location - being situated only 400 yards from Central Station and 50 yards from Dam Square makes a perfect base to explore. Staff - really friendly staff, helped with any queries. Rooms - Clean, free WIFI in room The negatives - Location - I would ensure you are not facing the Damrak it is a busy street. Rooms - unsure why there is a glass door on bathroom. Room 216 was relatively small, which I think you can expect in Amsterdam but you could not open bathroom door fully as the bed was located in the way. The shower pressure was not great. No milk was available for the tea / coffee. All of these were small issues and we did not raise them with staff as we used room as a base but I'm sure they would have dealt with them if required. Overall I would definately stop here again and would recommend the hotel to others. Location / Staff / Cleanliness were great. I shall look to stop here again on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from here”
Reviews.Author: commentmaker
Reviews.Content: reserved for 7 nights--stayed 2---no heat--4 blankets--no attempt by front desk staff to offer a warmer room. Could not get any of the 4-6 members of wait staff in the restaurant to even aknowledge us, never mind provide a menu and take our order. Hoorible experience. So much so, that we checked out after the second night and moved next door to the Swissotel. I advise you do the same. Swissotel was so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: abcdeLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Dam Square, very central and only a short walk from Centraal if you are getting the train in from Schipol. The hotel is clean and compact and perfect for a short break. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly, free WiFi in the rooms (a bit slow... but when has a hotel ever provided decent internet). The rooms are quite 'cosy', but this is Amsterdam and all the buildings are built this way. The beds were very comfortable. Downsides... no television unless you pay (this was not an issue for us because we were out most of the time, but may be for some people). The shower room had a very modern frosted glass door... this offers very little privacy, so watch out for those sharing a room how are not totally comfortable with this 'open' bathroom set up. Water pressure in the showers was also a bit low. Otherwise great hotel for a weekend city break, and also a great price. We paid in advance and got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “a shabby and dirty 2 star hotel .”
Reviews.Author: joharp
Reviews.Content: DON"T stay here. My husband and I booked into the De Roode Leeuw for a two night stay on the 30th October and checked out on the 31st October, paying extra money to change for earlier flights. The staff in the reception were very nice and told us when we checked in that they had given us a free upgrade (we don't know why ). As we had arrived early we had to wait until 1.o.clock-ish to go to our room which we didn't mind. How I wish we could of seen the room earlier so we could of walked straight out and found another hotel. The sofa and armchairs in the room were full of disgusting stains as was the carpet. Even a member of staff expressed embarrassment at the estate of the room and provided me with clean sheets to cover the chairs so we could sit down. Teacup was filthy, and the bathroom floor around the toilet was stained. Location was great and that was the only good thing about the hotel apart from leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubenportland
Reviews.Content: Thank you Hotel Amsterdam for the wonderful visit to Amsterdam. We have been staying with you for the last 20 years and always enjoy our stay. We cannot say enough about the staff and the care and kindness they have shown us.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back...can't wait!”
Reviews.Author: Lily53Ny
Reviews.Content: We checked out yesterday after a week at Hotel Amsterdam-De Roode Leeuw. It was our first time in this city and we were so pleased with the location as well as the warm welcome we received. The room was very clean and comfortable on the 3rd floor where we received excellent service from the housekeeping staff. Indeed, we did have to squeegie the shower floor but just laughed it off as were on holiday and just assumed it was a "European plumbing thing". We were informed that the issue should be resolved by the time we come back. The staff at the desk were most pleasant and willing to help us with directions and information at all hours. The only time we experienced smoking odors was when we went to use the internet on the 1st floor (that is where the smoking rooms are). The lobby and the floor where we stayed had no odor of cigs. The room used for the internet is quiet and secure; however, I wished there was another computer I could have used because I did want to check my email from time to time to check on things from home and the area was often occupied (seemed like the same 2 people were always in there). Unfortunately we didn't get around to eating at the restaurant but we did get room service early one morning and we were very pleased with the freshness, choices, and amounts of food provided. Check- out was a breeze and we all had a great time chatting with the staff while we waited for our taxi to the airport. So long to Hotel Amsterdam! We really enjoyed our stay. See you all next year!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: plod1127
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The location is fantastic - less than 100 metres to Dam Square, 10 min walk to the train station (to which most people use when travelling to and from the airport). The hotel is on the busy street of Damrak so if you want a view then you will probably get the street noise. We had a room away from the front and was quiet and very clean. However, like most European city hotel rooms (unless you pay big money) it was very small and this is the only reason that I could not rate this hotel as a 5 star. Although this can't be helped and was not a serious concern of ours as we were out all day. The only thing we were not happy about was the cost of using their internet. This was very expensive when you only want to use 5 mins to print off an airflight boarding pass. We found an internet cafe down the street charging 1/4 the price. The staff are excellent, very courteous, friendly and 'never' kept us waiting. When we visit Amsterdam again we will be staying at Hotel Amsterdam - DeRoode Leeuw.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DarylGeneral
Reviews.Content: We came here on our honeymoon and the staff and management were fantastic. They really acknowledged our honeymoon and went out of their way to accommodate us in the best manner possible. I read other reviews about this place being in a great location, but I was still pleasantly surprised that it was so central to all of the best places Amsterdam had to offer plus just a short walk to the Central train station. Instantly we felt like we were part of that amazing city and its culture. I will undoubtedly stay there again next time I go to Amsterdam. -Daryl Eyjolfson

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and central - I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_55er
Reviews.Content: From the time I checked in (slightly early) I received very friendly and helpful service for my two nights. The room and especially the shower/toilet facilities were very functional and clean. It was easy to get to and and from Centraal Station with my suitcase via the trams that travel down Damrak. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good interior but smell of cigarettes”
Reviews.Author: marchellica
Reviews.Content: Just met expectation. Great location, within 50m from Dam Square. All I need is just to walk to the city's attractions. Room interior looks brand new. Breakfast are not included. You have to pay for internet connection, which you can get for free from a nearby McD. One thing the hotel must fix is the smell of cigarrettes (probably cannabis) in the alley and the room. Although the room is declared non-smoking room and free of cannabis, it is still smelly. But this is fixable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Great Hotel, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: carrie_i_NZ
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I booked the day before I arrived in Amsterdam and still got a decent rate, when I arrived was given a free upgrade to a superior room and was made to feel really welcome. The room was great (a little small but clean and tidy) and had a window overlooking a rather dingy alleyway, but no fault of the hotels! I stayed for 3 nights and stored my luggage on the last day at no charge. The location is wonderful, in one of the main streets and really central to everything. The restaurant downstairs (that also does the room service) was great if a little over priced. The staff were extremely helpful, gave me great directions and assistance when i needed it. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm staff with warm attitude”
Reviews.Author: Isaac-Pearl
Reviews.Content: I give the Amsterdam-Hotel De Roode Leeuw a 5 stars rate for some reasons The first and most important is the hotel staff. the staff was really really professional and had so much patience for our questions and needs, it has no price! The second is it's location, the hotel located in Dam-Square which is a very central place in Amsterdam. you can walk from there almost to any place in Amsterdam. If you're planning a trip to Amsterdam, the Amsterdam-Hotel would be great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff and "couldnt care" attitude”
Reviews.Author: RoosterNEScotland
Reviews.Content: This was very expensive for what it is. Booked it through British Airways, maybe that is why. Anyway the place is really only a two star at best. Tiny room looking into an inside stairwell. Front desk staff execced themselves in being listless, rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbo81
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break to Amsterdam and stayed at De Roode Leeuw. The hotel is centrally located just a short walk from Central Station and within easy walking distance of the main attractions such as Madame Tussaud's, Red Light District etc. The staff are very polite and courteous. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was very clean and tidy with daily room cleaning. The room is small but has everything that you need. The ensuite is very small but with modern decor. The shower area is again very small and you cannot shower without flooding the entire room but a heat lamp is provided to dry out the floor. The ensuite is my only complaint with this hotel otherwise I was really pleased with my stay. The hotel also has a restaurant located on the ground floor but we never ate here as we were staying on a room only basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great facade - poor quality rooms unless you pay more and more”
Reviews.Author: acmee001
Reviews.Content: Wonderful restaurant with great service however the room we experienced was hidden in the centre of the hotel with another wall being the view from the window. Noise from the room above was atrocious listening to occupants performing their ablutions and moving about their room. While generally well equipped with all the standard features, the room is small and incredibly stuffy unless you have the aircon on all the time. It is not the place to spend a week visiting Amsterdam in. Of course you can upgrade @ 25 euro a night but, cynically - that seems to be part of the cunning plan. I would not recommend this hotel unless you were assured of a room with a window with an external view and access to fresh air. Go to a modern hotel such as the Plaza. Our mistake and we won;t make it again. By the way - we reported our concerns to management in writing and guess what - no response - even to replacing the broken chair. Not sure whether that is the norm or simply an aberration but you will get the gist.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - worth paying extra for the large room”
Reviews.Author: Goonerette
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff who go out of their way to be helpful. My husband and I spent our 3rd wedding anniversary at the hotel who even supplied a bottle of wine to help us celebrate once they knew why we were staying! We had an exceptionally large room on the 1st floor and paid the small amount extra to upgrade when booking which is well worth the extra money. The room was a little dated in terms of looks, but it was clean and spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Amsterdam. Location is great, on top of Dam square and within walking distance of everywhere you want to visit too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms were very small...”
Reviews.Author: Holiday6547
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were very small (this was to be expected considering the location) staff could have been nicer

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0701
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just 10 minutes walk from Central Station in an excellent location - walking distance from all the main attractions. We were a family of 5 and had 2 rooms, one slightly larger to accommodate the extra person. The rooms are comfortable but not luxurious although have everything one needs (mini bar, tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer etc) and the price was fairly reasonable. Beds are clean and comfortable. Bathrooms have been renovated although the showers do not have shower curtains/screens which is a pity as the water tends to make a bit of a mess on the floor. What really made our stay so enjoyable were the polite and exrtremely helpful staff. They were happy to book museum tickets on line for us and assist us with advice - all speaking excellent English and very friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Crispy506
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not appear to be clean to me. The carpets were stained and my bedspread had a cigarette burn in it. At night I heard noises in the wall that sounded like some sort of insect. The bed was two single beds pushed together. One of them had a spring sticking up in the middle of my back. The bathroom was efficient but not special. I also found when I got home that there was an extra charge on my credit card which I was not given a receipt. I am still trying to figure out why I was charged and what for. I must say the front desk staff was incredibly helpful and informative which was the only bright spot in my stay at this hotel. It was inexpensive so I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Clean rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: EBach_SanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from the train station and very centrally located. The rooms are on the smaller side but comfortable, clean and well done. The bathroom I had was remodeled. The staff was excellent. I plan to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Alfiepoo
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a fantastic trip to Amsterdam. This hotel is in a great location a 10 mins walk from the station and easy access to the other main tourist areas. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly and you can't really fault the hotel. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms are lovely. We were even left a laundry bag of clean towels when the maid couldn't get in to our room when we had a lie in. I would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very kind”
Reviews.Author: Sherwood-Tenerife
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam at 4 a.m., only to find that the Suissotel at which we had reserved was overbooked. They had, however, arranged a room at the same price at the Hotel Amsterdam. The room was fine - the other couple traveling with us said theirs was very, very nice - but above all the staff was especially nice. They offered, without being asked, to waive their 11 am checkout time as they thought we might be too tired the next morning. Although I would not pay the standard price I see on the web for this hotel, at the price we paid, it was excellent price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Amsterdam? Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: aky13
Reviews.Content: First, I must advise that my wife and I generally do NOT stay at 5 star hotels because we do not need or want room service and we do not appreciate paying for a fancy lobby. We seek hotels that are CLEAN, that provide rooms with private bathroom facilities and that are conveniently located to public transportation so we are not tied to expensive taxis. Helpful staff are always a plus! This hotel, de Roode Leeuw (the Red Lion) had it all. The ONLY reason I rated the sleep quality as 4 instead of 5 was that they did not have a queen or king sized bed and we prefer a larger bed. I rated the room as only 4 of 5 because it was TINY. HOWEVER, unless you pay a LOT more for a European hotel room, tiny is what you will get almost everywhere! Perhaps best of all were the â€œfront endâ€� people. They were knowledgeable, they were helpful, they were courteous, and they were friendly. You cannot beat the transportation convenience of this hotel. One of the city's tram lines stopped right in front of the hotel entrance! De Roode Leeuw is located on a main street and is actually a very short walk from the main train station. Since we traveled from Amsterdam to Bruges, Belgium by train, this was VERY convenient. Furthermore, the starting point for canal tours is in front of the train station, slightly closer to the hotel. The hotel is also within walking distance of many sights of this wonderful city. I recommend a stroll through the infamous "Red Light" district, even if you are happily married and with your partner. It is quite interesting. The hotel has its own restaurant, and there are many interesting shops nearby if you just like to browse the touristy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JudyVirginiaBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel because of it's location and he chose well. This hotel is close to shopping, restaurants and trams run right outside the hotel. Noise could be a problem for some as one can hear a lot of goings on at the square. One can also walk to central station. Check in was quick, staff friendly enough not overly but can answer any questions you have. Sign in hotel stating no drugs/smoking allowed or else you will be charged 100 euros immediately. Our room was overlooking the de Bijenkorf Department store (similar to Nordstrom/Harrods) and can go and eat there on their restaurant on the 5th floor. Very good cafe located on the 1st floor too. Beds are similar to twin beds but it suited our needs although I am used to king sized beds.No free wifi and internet is costly. Breakfast buffet 15 euros /pperson. We stayed there for a week in a "superior" room.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonnieB4
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely helpful, very central location and rooms renovated- be aware of internet payment though. If smokers advise to book a smoking room before Reasonable for its location which saves a lot on tram and travel fares.Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...staff...PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Worker77
Reviews.Content: I was just for a couple of nights in Amsterdam! My company booked this hotel and it was a great stay! If you needed some help the staff of the front-desk were there for you! The food in de restaurant was SUPER. They know howe to serve a good meal for a good price...service in the restaurant....SUPER en very proffesional. The rooms were a bit small but very clean.....and it was only for sleeping. Next time???? YES!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: LoveAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel I was greeted with such friendliness and professionalism by all staff. The staff is 5star. The hotel is 5star. The location is 5star. The restaurant is 5star. Everything about this hotel is 5star. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. 1st Class Location”
Reviews.Author: 55Minny
Reviews.Content: Centrally located this hotel is ideal as a base for anywhere in Amsterdam. We got train from airport and then walked from station (10 minutes) and then got hop on hop off ticket for water bus. All very convenient and easy. Staff all made a point of being friendly and room was clean and had everything you could want (except a nice view!) We were at the back. The good bit of this though was that we never heard any noise from the street. A lot of guests seem to complain on here about the glass door on bathroom but this was not a problem and at least it is obscured glass. Bathroom was rather small with loo and sink very close but nevertheless was not a huge complaint. We found the retaurant too expensive for our budget but at least being central you can find alternatives for breakfasts and meals in easy walking distance. All in all a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “A great "trip"”
Reviews.Author: Sonro
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, lovely hotel, clean, tidy, great room service. Bathroom very satisfactory, very comfy bed, good selection of movies for all ages, and not too expensive. We did not eat there however, but the location was brilliant as there were so many restaurants at our doorstep. A 5-10 minute walk from the nearest coffee shop and Red Light District. Although our room backed onto a street, we were not woken up early or kept up late, however, the time at which we slept was not kept :) It's a great place if you want to experience the real Amsterdam way of life but still be able to get back to a comfy bed and warm room with a tasty selection in the minibar (be careful not to raid once returning from the coffee shops - it can add up!). Towels were always clean, and bed always made with clean sheets. We are going back this summer (2010) and cannot wait! We both recommend it highly... to anyone. In brief; in the heart of everything it gives you just the right touch to make your Amsterdam holiday perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: KristofKnokke_Heist
Reviews.Content: The people at the reception are very kind and polite, they help you with all your problems and demands, the search the info that your are asking for. In the restaurant they are also very kind and polite, the food was excellent. We really enjoyed our vacation with them

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: DCHV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam where we stayed for two nights at the Hotel Amsterdam - De Roode Leeuw. I have stayed in many mid-market city centre hotels and this hotel compared very favourably. The location of the hotel was perfect; close to everything (transport, restaurants, shopping, etc). I had booked a double room and that is what we got with no problem whatsoever. Mid-price city centre hotels tend to be â€˜compactâ€™ and this was as expected. The entrance and reception were small but perfectly adequate. We stayed in room 501 so that is all I have experience of. The room exceeded our expectations; plenty of space, excellent facilities, comfortable bed and very clean. As for the bathroom â€“ that was magnificent. Obviously newly installed and to the highest of standards. Other than breakfast, we did not eat in the restaurant so I cannot comment on the quality. However, I can say that the restaurant itself was very pleasantly appointed. The menu was traditional Dutch fare and appeared to be reasonably priced. This was endorsed by the fact that every evening and lunchtime it was extremely busy. Our room rate included breakfast which consisted of a hot and cold buffet. This was a relatively modest selection but perfectly adequate. My only comment would be that at â‚¬15 it appeared a bit on the expensive side. I have nothing to compare this with other than my experience in similar hotels in the UK. However, as breakfast was included in our rate this was not an issue. The staff, on reception and in the restaurant, were helpful and courteous at all times. Overall, the hotel offered above average value for money and made for a very pleasant weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed - european 4* is not to my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kat_wwe
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at De Roode Leeuw for a long weekend break and it was my first trip to Amsterdam. I had read some good reviews on this place so was hopeful it would meet expectations. Firstly, on the plus side, the location of this hotel was very good. Virtually next to Dam Square and very convenient for many of the central attractions. The location is busy at all hours but was an easy walk from the station, red light district, Anne Frank's house and the cruise tour depot. Getting around the city was very convenient from this hotel. On the negative side we were disappointed with the condition of our room. I have traveled around the world and seen all sorts of 4* hotels, this one I did not feel lived up to its status. The communal decor of the hotel (outside the small lobby) I felt was very dated and our room had peeling Artex wallpaper and felt dark with old fashioned mahogany fixtures and lurid starched bed covers. The external aspect over an air conditioning unit/back of a neighbouring building was not very pleasant but at least we could kind of see a bit of Nieuwe Kerk. I felt a bit embarrassed as I had booked this trip for me and my partner for a romantic getaway but I felt the quality of the room was far worse than any other 4* hotel we had visited and for the money I would have expected better. Nevertheless we tried to spend as little time as possible in the room. On the plus side the bathroom appeared to have been recently modernised with contemporary fixtures though it was extremely small and the open 'wet room' effect shower just made for a horrible wet floor around the toilet which was very unpleasant to be standing in. The staff were all friendly and helpful at the front desk but aside from that I would not reccommend this hotel if you are looking for a true quality get away. If you need a well located crash pad when city-breaking that is good for getting around, sure, this would probably suit your needs. But anything beyond that, if you seek a bit of character, charm, opulence, relaxation, no way - this is not the place for you. Maybe we were just unlucky with our particular room and in that part of the hotel. But as they say, it only takes one visit to make an opinion and sadly, mine was heartily disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: HapyIrishLad
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone Just back from a wonderful trip to Amsterdam. Stayed at the Hotel Amsterdam and I have to say its a very nice hotel to stay in, The staff are very friendly and helpful.
