The rooms are spotless and comfortable and like some reviews the bathrooms are a bit small but are kept in lovely condition and the shower is amazing, the bathrooms also have lovely handwash and shower gels too and a hairdryer for those who need it I do not enough said. The restaurant downstairs is where you have breakfast a lovely variety of cereals, juices, breads, cakes, cheese, ham etc and you can have a cooked breafast. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the train station in central Amsterdam and the location is perfect for everyone as everything is within walking or tram distance away, All in all a wonderful hotel and yes will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Clean & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: simplesimon70
Reviews.Content: I only booked this hotel above the others of similar price because the management had bothered to answer to reviews on this site. Upon arriving, the hotel was centrally located a convenient 5 minute walk from Central rail station up one of the main streets. The street itself was one of the noisier, dirty streets with trams & cars passing 24 hours a day, but once inside the hotel you could not hear any of this. The hotel itself was clean in both communal areas and rooms. We stayed in a comfort room which was small but then you're only there to sleep so it did not bother us. The bathroom was very small wet room design - although it was of modern style, and spotless clean. The glass door on the bathroom? Well since it was only 2 inches from your knees when sitting on the toilet it did provide a new visual experience for my partner which after 15 years together doesn't come that often!!! This has been addressed by the management for future refits - see previous comments. The staff were very polite and extremely helpful when I mentioned the room was very cold and quickly came up with a portable heater and more blankets. I would stay here again if I came to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Good service!”
Reviews.Author: altforrognan
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Hotel Amsterdam - De Roode Leeuw for four nights during christmas time, it was a birthday present for my boyfriend. I chose Hotel Amsterdam because of the location, and I must say that I loved it! It was walking distance to everything, except for the Hard Rock CafÃ©. The rooms were average, I thought the bathroom was OK, and the almost-transparent doors didn't bother me, but if you are travelling with someone not that close to you, it might be a problem. I thought the bed were really comfortable too. The hotelroom was clean, so I thought housekeeping did a good job. The staff were really helpful and nice, they were always smiling! Overall, I liked this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in a very nice hotel with comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MennoNetherlands
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, in the centre of Amsterdam, the place to be. The most important shops and highlights near the hotel. The staff off the hotel and restaurant where very friendly. I had a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: NorthernRiversNSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at this hotel recently and thought it was OK. I've visited Amsterdam five times in the past few years and have stayed at different hotels (3* and 4*) near Centraal Station each time, so my expectations were realistic. My 'smoking comfort room' at the Hotel Amsterdam was the smallest I've encountered so far, with the bathroom door not fully opening because the bed was in the way. The furniture was dated and the arms easily fell off the desk chair (which could barely fit). I was travelling solo and wasn't really concerned about the size of the room, the dated furniture, or about the opaque bathroom door, but can understand why others have commented. I wouldn't like to be sharing. The windows of my room opened to a view of a brick wall of the building across the laneway, and whilst uninspiring, I appreciated the central location of the hotel and that not every room can face the front. Fortunately(?), my view was of a portion of the building that did not have any windows, so I did feel a sense of privacy when I had my windows open. The heating in my room was adequate, the double-glazing kept the noise out, I slept well, and the staff were friendly. The room was clean and stocked with all of the usual ameneties, including a mini bar and although a surcharge was payable (15 Euro), I was grateful for the option of a smoking room (a rarity in Amsterdam). Would I stay here next time I visit? Probably not. I'll try somewhere different, again. But I wouldn't discourage you from staying if you're after a clean, central and convenient room with a bed and amenities. It's OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, medium quality...”
Reviews.Author: kathie_gemi
Reviews.Content: On the plus, the hotel's location was great, right in the heart of Amsterdam, making it easy for us to go around. The staff were accommodating, but not extremely helpful. We were initially put in a twin room although we had specifically requested a double, without even being advised why we were given a twin. We were changed to a double room the following day after we complained. This room was right opposite the elevator, hence extremely noisy; the management should really consider turning it into a storage room, since no one can get a decent sleep as the hotel is busy at all times. The other negative point about our medium sized room was that the bathroomâ€™s door was see-through glass and so you were able to see the toilet right in front of the bed. Also, the corridors had a musty, moldy aroma which thankfully was not passed on to the rooms. The overall impression was not that of a 4 star hotel, but rather that of a 3 star hotel. On the whole, we would probably stay here again due to the hotelâ€™s excellent location, but only under the assurance that we were given a bigger room, away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly but dissapointing room”
Reviews.Author: mistxx
Reviews.Content: Having already stayed in this hotel in July 2008 and loved every minute of it - had no hesitation booking a return trip expecting the same this year (for my partner's birthday). Was extrememly dissapointed with the room. The rooms appear to have been renovated since last year - unfortunately not for the better - The first room we were given was small, cramped and has a GLASS see through door to the toilet and shower which was right next to the bed (Not very pleasant - and certainly not very comfortable to sit on the toilet with a glass door and your partner being able to watch you from the bed (maybe it suits "some" people!). Immediately requested to change rooms due to the glass door issue - was told "most" rooms are like this (very dissapointed as the previous year the room was perfect with a large bathroom/toilet with a enclosed door for some privacy). Swapped to a room with a enclosed toilet which was tiny! (I'm 5ft 6 and my knees touched the door when sat on toilet - no basin in toilet) - Shower room still had a see through GLASS door with a small basin -no shelves at all, no area to put soap/shower gel etc - sounds minor, but strange for a 4 star hotel!. Overall a real shame as the renovated rooms made it feel i had been ripped off - since I actually paid almost Â£100 more this time round for what feels a lot less for my money - for location the hotel is superb, just a real shame the rooms do not reflect value for money at all - real shame as the staff and location could not be faulted. Will not be staying again on next trip - shame

Reviews.Title: “Reservation - What's One Of Those?”
Reviews.Author: jovialmonkeybusiness
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room to be told on arrival that they had 'run out'. They didn't seem to understand the concept of a reservation and gave us a twin instead. Bathroom doors are glass and so you can see the toilet 18 inches away from the bed. Despite asking for non smoking room ours smelled of smoke and to add insult to injury we had staff banging on the door through the night asking if we were smoking in the room!

Reviews.Title: “You will be more than pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: JuanPabloNYC
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site for Hotel Amsterdam-De Roode Leeuw do not do justice to this hotel. When traveling I look for hotels with good deals but based on the reviews I was not expecting much from this hotel. However, when I arrived, checked in, and saw my room I was extremely happy. The room was small, but you have to expect this in Europe. The staff were friendly, courteous, professional, helpful, and met all of our needs. Do not pay attention to the negative reviews for this hotel. I found them to be untrue and extremely dissapointing that people would be so callous as to tarnish the reputation of such a great hotel. The hotel setting is perfect. Right in the city center, approximately a 5-10 minute walk from Central Station. Attractions are near and shopping district is right behind the hotel. The view of the Royal Palais square from our room was wonderful and picturesque. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends, family, and particularly my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Parrot_Girl84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 9 nights from August 11th-20th in room 204. When I was booking, the front desk was more than helpful in making sure we had a smoking room at the front of the hotel. I was very pleased with the service before we even got there! When we arrived it was early morning, and check in isnt until 2 or 3, but the hotel was nice enough to store our bags for us while we walked around the city. I wasnt feeling very well so we came back to the hotel around noon and we were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was ready! The room was VERY clean, beds were VERY comfy, and the concierge was VERY helpful! The air conditioning was great too! The view from our room was very nice, with centraal station to the left, and dam square to the right. Lovely french doors opened up onto a small balcony. I enjoyed waking up in the morning, making a coffee and opening the doors to watch the city pass by... there were always so many people! lol I cant comment on the restaurants food, but the coffee was nice. This was my first trip to Amsterdam and this hotel made it great! The central location was key, always easy to find and a short walk or tram ride from wherever you are in the city. When I visit Amsterdam again, I will definitely be staying here! The only thing I would say needs to be improved ( and its not really that big of a thing) is the shower drainage. Didnt really bother me, but it might bother some. Thanks Hotel Amsterdam for a very memorable stay at your hotel, hope to be seeing you in the near future! Mel and Ryan

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: diana10314
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here for a week in Aug. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly as well. While the room was a bit small, it was no smaller than some hotel rooms in NYC that I've stayed in. We had no issues during our week stay. Our room had a balcony with french doors that did open up and faced the street. Even though we had a street view room, it was surprisingly quiet during the day. The bathrooms are a bit different than those in the U.S. in that the shower area is smaller and there is no shower curtain so the entire bathroom tends to get wet. However, the cleaning crew did a very nice job cleaning and wiping down the bathroom on a daily basis. While many people from the States may not be used to this, I was as this is done in countries in Asia as well. Keep in mind that you're in another country and not everything is the same as it is at home. I would definintely recommend staying here to anyone and everyone! It is centrally located and smack in the middle of the heart of Amsterdam. Also, while there is a tram stop right in front of the hotel, you can save yourself a few euros and just walk to the hotel from Amsterdam Centraal. It's only about a 10 min walk. I'm not really sure why some people have left such negative comments such as "MefoandMeho's." If you want all the bells and whisles in a hotel room then suck it up and pay the extra $200 /night up front on a room at a luxury hotel rather than trying to be a cheap skate and complaining about it after the fact then blaming it on the establishment not meeting your wants/expectations.

Reviews.Title: “i cant see what everyone is complaining about,its fab!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayney456
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in the amsterdam de roode de leeuw the end of aug for 4 nights,and i have to say i am really fussy where i stay. it HAS to be clean for a start,and it helps if the staff are friendly,and i like a comfy bed. the amsterdam came out tops on all fronts,the hotel may be an older property,(but then again you are in amsterdam and the whole city is full of older properties!)but it was fine,you never get complete home from home in any hotel,unless you pay for it,but we had everthing we needed,the rooms were cleaned every day,nice fresh towels,everyday,and ok the room was on the small side,but HELLO! its amsterdam,everywhere is small!! we stayed here about 7 yrs ago,and it has had a refurb,it might not be everyones taste,but its clean,comfy and quiet. we had a smoking room,which was requested and paid for,and it didnt stink like everyone says,ok we both smoke,bit not heavily,so think i would notice if it was smelly.cannot comment on the breakfast/restaurant,because we didnt use it,but the menu and restaurant look nice and cosy.and you can sit in the window and watch the world go by,literally!! the ONLY problem we had was when we checked out we were charged for using the mini bar,adding about 30â‚¬ to our bill.(we never use the mini bar,in any hotel because its too expensive,and just 5 mins away there is a shop) we couldnt prove we didnt have it,but after saying we didnt have it,a few times,the receptionist apologised for the mistake and removed it from our bill,no questions asked. all in all we had a fantastic time at the amsterdam,and in amsterdam,and we will definately be staying here again,in the very near future,depending on how nice i am to my husband!!!! lol!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: blueclavius
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed in. Great location, clean friendly and helpfull staff. This is not a large hotel like say a Marriott, but you get a more personal touch, unlike the big corporate hotels. This hotel is a short walk from the train station Amsterdam CS. And has a tram stop right outside. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected at all...we left our first night there to a different HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MefoandMeho
Reviews.Content: If you are anything like my husband and I then you WILL NOT like this Hotel. Right when we walked into the lobby we knew we were in trouble. The hotel is very run down and extremely old. The rooms are on the darker side and again very old with a musty smell. The remodeling of the bathrooms is a joke and done very cheaply. None of the rooms really offer you any sort of nice view, either you are facing the alley with tons of loud people walking by and a mcdonalds sign is right in your view. Most of the rooms are very loud and you will not have a peaceful and quite stay here. If you like newer and updated this is NOT the hotel for you. If you like open, airy, and bright rooms this is NOT the hotel for you. If you like quite and peace this is NOT the hotel for you. If you like having nice views from your room this is NOT the hotel for you. We left within 30 min after checking in and expedia took care of us immediately. I do have to say the front desk girl and manager were very very nice to us. We loved how they treated us the little bit of time we were there, but their sweetness was not going to change how dissapointed we felt with the hotel itself. We did not like it all and would never book a room there. It was totally worth paying $200 more and stayed at a absolutely gorgeous hotel with views of the river/canals to die for!!! We know the hotel manager will respond to this review, and we appreciate their time. Oviously they have a lot of great reviews, but for the people that are anything like us we want to warn and save them time and stress of getting to a hotel they will be dissapointment with.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected......”
Reviews.Author: DrandMrsRoper
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with expedia for a 10 wedding anniversary weekend trip basing our choice on the pictures on the website which looked really nice. The lobby of the hotel was small, efficient and the hotel staff courteous, friendly and helpful. Our room 114, was quiet possibly the worst I have ever seen. Although advertised as 4 star hotel our room was dark, poorly decorated, with stained walls and carpet and a view of next doors air conditioning units. The bathroom looked like it was built over 10 years ago, was not very clean but we didn't stay to find out. We asked for a different room but none was available until the next day. We dumped our bags, searched the immediate area and booked into the crown plaza a few streets away. We checked out of the Hotel Amsterdam - De Roode Leeuw within 2 hours and were told that we would be refunded for one of our two night booking. If all you want is a room to rest your head then its probably fine but absolutely not a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Friendly Hotel in the Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MiskyB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for over a week, and were very impressed with this hotel. The location cannot be beat - very convenient, just off Dam Square and right by a tram stop. The front desk and housekeeping staff were helpful and friendly. Shopping, dining, nightlife and everything else are just steps away. Although our interior room lacked an impressive view, we found it to be very quiet and peaceful, even with the window open. (This is not always the case with Amsterdam hotels). Also, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept on. The all-you-can-eat breakfast was very good, although we ended up sampling different nearby options to save money throughout our stay. Our room was smaller than the typical American hotel room we are used to. This was not a problem for us, but might be for some folks. I would not recommend trying to cram more than 2 people to a room. Also, the bathroom was a bit odd to us, as the door was see-through. In my experience, this is not unusual for a European hotel, but could be awkward if you're not used to it. We greatly enjoyed our stay and found ourselves looking forward to returning after each day of sightseeing. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Horace121
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel which is ideally situated just off Dam Square. Intially in a smoking Room however the hotel staff were very accommodating when we requested to be moved to a non smoking room and told us we could change rooms the next morning when one would be available. Nice clean room with walk in shower. Ideal location to explore on foot or to catch a tram with a stop directly outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Staff, and Room A++”
Reviews.Author: 5EI8008
Reviews.Content: My beautiful bride and I stayed here (May 3-5) on the last city of our honeymoon vacation, and we were both impressed by the hotel overall. It was easy to find from the train station, the front desk staff was quick, cheerful, and friendly throughout our three day stay (thanks so much, Virginia!), and the room was much more than we were expecting after staying the past week in hotels in London and Paris. The room itself was very spacious and clean, and a fun mix of modern and aged fixtures (flat screen tv and modern bathroom fixtures and windows juxtaposed the curtains, lamp shades, and carpet that hinted of the disco era - though very clean). The amenities were great, and everything was kept stocked and cleaned daily. The showering area was different than we are accustomed to (squeegie included), but we read that full sized tubs are quite a luxury in this area, so it was not a surprise. The bed and pillows were comfortable, and the lighting more than adequate (we had the corner room three stories above the entrance with four huge windows and a smaller bathroom window). I was very impressed with the security of the hotel (in room safe, room key required to use the elevator, and small lobby the required you walk just feet from the 24hr attendant to access the hotel). Breakfast was always good, and the service was always fast and friendly. We also ate at the restaurant for a classic regional dinner, and rate it a 9/10 as well (see the restaurant review for more). The staff seemed to truly enjoy their jobs (or at least acted as such very well), which made the stay very pleasant. (We also happened to stay during a holiday and were able to watch the Queen assist in the Memorial Day event from our window!) I can't remark as to the overall value because we booked our entire EU trip through Avanti, so I'm not sure how much we paid for this particular hotel, but I can say I will definitely come back and stay again. This hotel was a great part of our first trip to Amsterdam. Thanks to the managers and staff for such a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: nugemolaca
Reviews.Content: Once again, careful reading of tripadvisor reviews guided us to this hotel. The staff were helpful, professional and courteous. The room was large and nicely decorated. We did pick it also because of its location, and because of this, it was pretty loud during the day. This wasn't a problem for us, since we were out by mid-morning, contributing to the street noise ourselves. It was quiet in the evening after the stores shut down. I will also have to say the restaurant food and staff were a double-bonus to our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: greenwireless
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, they are clean and very well put together. The staff is fantastic, helpfull and knowledgeable. The restaurant is absolutely top-notch, but the best thing about this hotel is it's location. Virtually on top of Dam square, we were able to easily walk to anywhere we wanted to go, and I felt like we had front row seats for Queens Day celebrations. We will definately be back to Amsterdam, and unless they're booked solid I plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing we didn't want to spend much time in our room.”
Reviews.Author: 1Carmen1
Reviews.Content: We did our research on TripAdvisor about the Hotel Amsterdam, and we saw that there were more good reviews than bad ones. Plus, the price was right in the package we booked, so we took the faith leap and booked our 5 night stay here. We were also impressed that the hotel management responded to each review on TripAdvisor - however, I've realized now that a management response AFTER you've had a bad experience doesn't really help you when you're holding your nose to tolerate the bathroom smell while you're there. I wish we'd have forked up the extra $200 and stayed somewhere else. I'm a travel writer, and try to be fair in my reviews, but honestly, I can't recommend that you stay here. There is one good thing I can think of - LOCATION. If location is what swings you on a hotel room, you really canâ€™t beat the Hotel Amsterdam. Itâ€™s a 5-7 minute walk down Damrak to Central Station, and you can practically spit on Dam Square, with the Royal Palace. For those Americans that just canâ€™t stay away, there is a McDonalds and a KFC right next door. If vices are up your alley, then itâ€™s mere steps from the Red Light District, the Vodka Museum and the Sex Museum. There are tons of restaurants within walking distance, and thereâ€™s a tram stop smack dab in front of the front door. That's where the good stopped for us. We werenâ€™t terribly impressed with the room we were given upon check in. Located on the first floor, it looked worn and drab. It was large for a European room, which was great, but it was big on size and small on, well, nice. Stains on the carpet, worn spots on the chairs, and two twin beds instead of one king. We were right next to a shared-by-all-guests restroom (though each room had itâ€™s own) and was straight across from the elevator. It was loud, and kind of seedy-looking, so we asked to change rooms. It wasnâ€™t possible the first night, but we were moved on night two. The new room wasnâ€™t as big, but had a king bed and looked at first glance to have more charm. There were stained glass windows and a balcony overlooking the Damrak. However, if you peeked behind curtains, there were mouse-sized holes in the walls (chewed by whom?) and more stains. Not to mention that the great view during the day became an overlook for party central at night. We went from a loud room to a louder room. Additionally, the hot water in the bathroom sink didnâ€™t actually heat up until you turned thebathtub water on. We shouldâ€™ve complained again, but my boyfriend didn't think it would help, and we didnâ€™t want to be the rude Americans, so we put up with it and avoided our room until we absolutely needed to sleep. The worst part was the smell that stank up our bathroom - it was almost unbearable. It smelled like the mildew had become self-aware, it had been there for so long. It got to the point where we had to hold our nose to shower. The staff werenâ€™t the brightest bulbs in the bunch, either. There were a few exceptions, but I expected them to be more help with directions and activities (but they werenâ€™t.) We try very hard not to be the "spoiled American" tourists, and have come to understand and accept the differences between what a 3-star is in the States and what it is in Europe. Plus, I seldom spend a lot of time in my room - I'd rather be out experiencing the culture and seeing the sites. Thank goodness this beautiful city overshadowed the bad hotel experience. There are so many hotels to chose from, and honestly, in a city with public transport as good as this one, I canâ€™t imagine that any location would have you too far from the action. So to the manager that may respond - you had your chance to make it right. You didn't. And now every article/post/Tweet that I write about the Netherlands will extol the beautiful country and warn against a stay in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: SherriD555
Reviews.Content: A really difficult one this - we've just come back from a few nights at this hotel and picked a gorgeous sunny time in wonderful Amsterdam. My other half says 'it's just somewhere to sleep' but if you're like me, you look forward to day trips then coming back to your hotel to freshen up etc so it's a bit more than that. The good sides - we loved the location, it was totally spot on and not at all noisy even though it was right on Damrak. The main square is less than one minutes walk and the tram stop is just outside. Staff were friendly, well presented and breakfast was good with a wide range of food on offer. If things run out, don't be afraid to ask as they are really happy to help. The not so good side - the hotel (according to signs up in it) has had a smoking ban since July 2008 - all the rooms on our floor had smoking signs on them (we stayed on 2nd floor) and there was an ashtray and matches in our room. I have to be brutal here but our room absolutely STUNK of smoke. The curtains, the chairs, the over cover on the bed - it really was off putting -I was all for complaining but my 'keep the peace' other half said he could live with it as we were hardly going to be in it. In the shower (which was FAB and hot and lovely) there was nowhere to put your shampoo/soap etc so it had to go on the floor around your feet - not ideal. The toilet was a 'shelf loo' so everything that goes down there sits on a shelf before being washed away - I had a real problem with this as we didn't see this anywhere else in the City. Maybe it was because it was smelling of stale smoke, but the room felt dirty and unfortunately it was only as we were leaving and did an 'under the bed search for stuff left behind' did we find someone elses slippers - it looked like it hadn't been hoovered in weeks. The reason this review is hard is because we've agreed that if we go to Amsterdam again, we would probably stay here for the location but ask to be transferred to another room if there was a problem. Halfway through our stay a lovely staff member asked if all was ok and I stupidly said 'yes' - I just hate to make a scene so thought it easier to shut up - I now wish I'd said something as although not for my husband, for me it really made the whole trip a little tainted. Such a shame as a great location but please guys, give room 225 a deep clean, get fresh furnishings and keep on top of the cleaners - and get rid of the ashtrays!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler027
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three nights and had a blast! Our room was ready as soon as we arrived, about 11:00am. The reception staff were so friendly and answered all of our questions. The room was very comfortable and had a great view of the square. We were a little worried about the shower not having a door or curtain, but surprisingly it was fine and the shower was great. The beds were so comfortable as well. We didn't eat at the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. But the location of this hotel is unbeatable. Just steps from the Dam Square and the Red Light District and from anything that you would need or want. Before we even left we were planning our next trip back to Amsterdam, and we'll definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid It!”
Reviews.Author: NancyArmstrong
Reviews.Content: Although we had made a reservation, we were late arriving because of delayed train. Gruff reception, immediate payment demanded, before sending us up to the room. We asked about food and were told only Macfdonalds was available. The room was awful - ICE COLD and SMELLY, and unkempt looking. When we complained, there was no hint of apology, so we left and found a MUCH nicer, warmer and friendlier hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Amsterdam is a wonderful place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rubenportland
Reviews.Content: Christmas Beer It was the best Christmas gift I could have gotten, a free beer at Hotel Amsterdam. Maybe the waiter in the restaurant Roode Leuw was impresssed when I returned the little tray with the beer and wine glasses which weâ€™d ordered earlier. Iâ€™d carried them up those steep Dutch stairs to our third floor room, astounding my wife. She is still unaccoustomed to my prowess on the stairs. She takes the lift. If Iâ€™m not distracted by a conversation with the clever kids at the front desk, I usually win our race. Now, on my return trip for a second beer, I told the waiter my wife would never believe heâ€™d just given me a free drink, she whoâ€™d doubted I could make it to our room with beer and wine glasses still full. The beer had sweated a little bit onto the trayâ€™s doily, but the only wine spill occured when I reached our floor. I was so relieved I let my guard down. Still, I was triumphant. This must be how those Dutch guys feel as they bound up and down Amsterdam stairs. Itâ€™s a very good way to keep in shape. The waiter hadnâ€™t really seem surprised when I returned for that second glass of beer. Perhaps he himself was a beer lover and knew how hard it is to drink just one glass of Dutch beer. Heâ€™d seemed impressed when I paid in cash earlier. Theyâ€™re thrifty, those Dutch guys. Itâ€™s too easy to charge to your room, and thatâ€™s how nasty bills grow. Drinking what you can pay for will keep you honest. My second trip, he spoke only in Dutch. Maybe he just thought heâ€™d surprise this feisty old American dude. I reached in my pocket to pay for my new glass sitting sparkling on its tray, and the waiter, a big smile on his face, waved me off. It was on the house. â€œFeine Kerst dag,â€� he beemed. I now had another astounding feat with which to amaze my wife. We've been returning to Hotel Amsterdam for over twenty years now, and intend to do so for twenty more. It is a wonderful place. Like home.

Reviews.Title: “well managed Dutch hotel next to Dam square”
Reviews.Author: fabmc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights and I liked it. The management really cares for tripadvisor reviews, and they try to give their customers the best possible service. I wish all hotels were like this one. The location is good and rooms offer a good European standard of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bathplumber
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amsterdam Hotel for 4 nights 4th to 8th Dec 2008. It was a joy, staff were polite & so helpful. the room although small was very clean & the bathroom, which looked new was lovely. Its in a great position & the restaurant is really good. I will go back. John Gray, Bath Uk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Amsterdam - Fab Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MissHappyPants
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked an apartment but were let down and found ourselves in Amsterdam with no accommodation, we walked down the Damrak and saw Hotel Amsterdam. They were brilliant and found us two rooms with no hesitation. The staff, especially ?Jeron (a gentleman on reception) were extremely polite and helpful and the hotel itself had a lovely safe feeling to it. The rooms were perfectly adequate for a traveller, they were very clean, warm and well equipped. The hotel location is brilliant for people to get out and about. The Hotel restaurant offered a fantastic selection for buffet breakfast and also in the evening, again the staff were so friendly and accommodating it was a joy to eat there. I love visiting Amsterdam and will always turn to the Hotel Amsterdam to provide me with accommodation. I found my stay there to be an extremely enjoyable experience. Tracie Hatcliffe Birmingham UK.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: Cedric_The_Cat
Reviews.Content: Very central location. Tram stop right out side the front door. Easy walking distance from the Centraal Train Station. Close to the Red light District, the Dam etc. Easy to get on a tram or walk down to Anne Frank's House and catch a Canal Bus. On arrival we were shown to a room which clearly was not the superior twin we had booked via Hotels.com ( a very small Standard room with a view of a brick wall!). I enquired at reception and showed them a copy of the booking. After much to-ing and fro-ing, it was admitted that we weren't in the room we had booked and that all of the Superior rooms were booked! This problem soon turned to our advantage when they offered us a Junior Suite - much better, even if I had to share a bed (albeit a King with pillows down the middle) with my elderly mother. Staff professional and courteous. Looked straight out onto Damrak but very quiet thanks to the the double glazing. Plenty of shops very close by for cheap food - salad roll, pastries, drinks etc. Walk a little bit further for cafes etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: guy2706
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights with my sister. The location is divine. It is admittedly a very touristy and noisy area but the hotel is 5-10 minutes walk from everywhere! The central station is a few minutes away and the shopping area, red light district and many other attractions are very close. The hotel is not too new or too luxurious- it is, however, perfectly fine. The rooms are clean and spacious and the staff is really nice and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: scunnybunny78
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at this hotel, The whole hotel was immaculate and the staff courteous and professional. The room was well equipped (very grateful for the air conditioning) and everything in the room worked. The bathroom was very small (shower only) but was well decorated and everything was in full working order. The location could not have been better, about 3 mins walk from centraal station and practically on the Dam. I did not eat in the restaurant, but please do not take this as a criticism, I just didn't get round to it. Every time I walked past the restaurant, at any time of day, it was either full or very nearly full which as a hotel manager in the UK, I know is the sign of a very, very good restaurant! In summary, a very well run hotel, clean, well presented, with a good restaurant (going on number of diners). My only criticism (and it is very minor indeed) is that the welcome from some of the staff was very polite and courteous but felt a little 'mechanical' and not too genuine. However, do not let this put you off! The Roode Leeuw is very, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: stickyfingers85
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel and flight through expedia for 2 nights for a great price. The hotel is in a great location! Walking distance from the train station (5 min) and all the main attractions. The staff were very friendly and always chatty and welcoming. The rooms are average really, a little worn down but clean and comfortable. I would recommend the hotel for a short stay as your really only going to be in there for sleep and for that its fine! However, please note that Internet Access is not free and they charge a tourist tax upon checkout as well

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dsleazy
Reviews.Content: As usual I spent some time researching good places to stay on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed with this selection. I have been to Amsterdam once before and stayed in a Hotel quite near to the Anne Frank House but this was a little too far from all the action for my liking, albeit only a short walk. The Hotel de Roode Leeuw (Red Lion) is perfectly situated about 30 metres from Dam Square right in the heart of Amsterdam. It is a short walk from the train station and is on a main street with plenty of amenities close by. There is a popular restaurant downstairs which, although I didn't choose to eat there, seemed to offer a good standard of food as most of the clientele appeared to be smartly dressed locals. The hotel itself was very clean and tidy. Our twin room (I stayed with my brother) was modern, clean and comfortable. There was TV, internet access, safe, mini-bar, coffee making facilities and plenty of wardrobe space in the room. The bathroom was spacious and clean with a good powerful shower unit. Breakfast was not included and when this is the case I prefer to go out and explore the area to find somewhere to have a nice breakfast. In this case I found a nice cafe on a sidestreet and had a croissant with some dutch flatbread and jam. Local tax was added to our hotel bill when we checked out. I think this was 6 euros for our one nights stay so be prepared for this if you are on a tight budget. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and if I return to visit Amsterdam again I would be very happy to stay at The Roode Leeuw.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & nice staff - But not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: J26Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Me and girlfriend stayed here for a 5 nights in August. Overall, it was a good experience. However, this hotel should be rated a 3-star. See below for specifics: The Good: Close to Central Station, Red Light District, and shopping. Friendly staff. Good water pressure on showers. The Bad: Room had dirty and stained carpet and very dated furniture (renovations badly needed). Noise from streets.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: GrimGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Booked a trip to Amsterdam for my husbands 40th. A group of 10 made up of mostly family and a couple of friends. Quite a few people to please!, but the hotel is very well situated right in the heart of the city and with in an easy walk from Central station Every thing was easily with in walking distance and the tram system works very well to go a bit further. The hotel is very comfortable and clean rooms were a good size, not sure I liked the glass door for the bathroom my husband definetly did'nt! but a part from that no complaints from any one in our party. Good value clean quite and central, we all had a great time. Blyn Mccarthy sep 2008

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: SianAndBilly
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the edge of Dam Square. 5 minutes walk from central station which has v efficient link to airport. Good amenities-kettle,safe , well appointed bathroom etc. Breakfast selection rather limited particularly on the hot & fruit fronts.We asked for quiet room as it would be noisy in the front. Home to on of the city's top restaurants serving dutch cuisine. Well worth eating there & as residents we received a discount. Would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wicked hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolves2100
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right on the edge of dam square, all within walking distance of all the action amsterdam has to offer. The hotel it self was excellent, very clean and the staff extreamley friendly. The room was very big and the bathroom an excellent size and the mini bar not to over priced. But beware of city tax, upon checkout we had to pay 4 euros per day extra which we where not expecting! But overall the best city i have visited and the quality of the hotel made the experience better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Earthy_Feet
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Amsterdam de Roode Leeuw and really enjoyed it. It's location is amazing, central to everything, the Dam Square, Central Station, Red Light District, Chinatown. Almost all of the tram routes pass by either the front of the hotel or behind the hotel, depending on the route. Central Station is walking distance, about 10 minutes (without carrying luggage). I don't really know or care about star ratings, I think that sort of thing is silly. Our room and bed was clean with sound resistant windows. The bathroom was also clean. Our windows looked out onto the roof of the next building and the room was "cozy", but I expected that for a hotel centrally located in a compact European city. You can tell that the common areas of the hotel permitted indoor smoking at one time, but the odor was faint and not a problem. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TorTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location on Damrak right at Dam Square and easy walking distance to Central Station. Makes a great 'home base' for discovering the city, and is also convenient for discovering other towns near Amsterdam given its location near the Central Station. We were able to get to nearby Harleem in about 20 minutes. Nothing is too far from this location....either by foot or by Tram. We had a room on the side (south) of the building, on the third floor. With windows closed, it was quiet enough. You do hear some of the partiers outside, but hey it's Amsterdam. The decor was average to good, but clean and more than fine. All staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never a 4* star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PJScotty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel De Roode Leeuw from Thu 5th June - Sun 8th June ( got back about 5 hrs ago) First of all it was 575 euros between 2 for a twin comfort room & 50 euros deposit for the mini-bar. We checked in & all was pleasant, the girl behind the desk was very polite & friendly. We made are way to the room & straight away i knew it wasn't going to be good value. The carpet was very dated throughout all the hallways and landings, leading this to i slight danky smell. The rooms were not big enought to swing a cat & were very dated and poorly decorated. Now i don't mind if it's small if it's nicely set out but for 575 euros, & it supposedly being a 4 star, i was not impressed. At checkout hey even had the cheek to charge 5% City tax, per day, per person!! God knows what a budget room was like? The staff being polite and good location are the good points but never in a million years is this a 4 star hotel. It has tea/coffee making facilities but al you get is...one tea bag, 1 sugar & 1 coffee per day. Terrible. I hate being ripped off so i'll mention the hotels i have stayed in that are ok in Amsterdam. Hotel Rho is a very good 3star & the tulip inn dam square is good also. Hope you make the right choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: octavius
Reviews.Content: I was one of a party of six friends. Some of the rooms were quite small but the staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms on the front of the hotel may be larger but Damrak (street where hotel is situated off Dam Square) is a very busy thoroughfare. The hotel is very central for all attractions and the hotel reception organised an Iamsterdam card which gives you free tram and metro fares and free entry to some attractions, reductions in entry and for some restaurants for 53 euros. Art is good, better than Paris. Didn't eat in the restaurant but it has good reviews for traditional Dutch cuisine. Breakfast was 13 euros but we found local cafes to eat in. But breakfast can mount up if you don't choose carefully. A small french cafe down from hotel gave good value for 5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mclaren1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Great Location on Damrak, across the road from Debjenkorf a great dpartment store & a stones trow from Dam Square. The walls were a little thin, we had a room backing onto the stairs & we could hear everyone coming up or down the stairs. The bathroom has a glass door, a bit bizarre, but hey it is Amsterdam! The breakfast was great, cereal, bacon, eggs, pastries-as much as you can eat. The reception staff were very friendly & rooms were very clean. Perfect for a weekend stay, if any longer the noise may begin to beother you

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LT170
Reviews.Content: Arrived home after 2 night weekend stay in this hotel,location was perfect on the edge of Dam square easy walk in distance to and from central station,shops,bars,red light district and flower market,flea market (saturday mornings) and Anne Franks House.The hotel room was a superior room it was large and had a large bathroom however the room was a little tired in decoration as was the bathroom so this was a little dissapointing for this rate,but we booked last minute and wekends are very busy,so our choice was limited we reccomend week days all round still busy and alive with action just not full full on people every where!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: idmac54
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great 4 night stay in Amsterdam, This hotel was very central for shopping / attractions and close to the Station. The Staff are very helpful and friendly.Rooms are modern, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent, just one down side...no toast!! We wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting Amsterdam.and plan to return soon. If you planning a trip to this great city stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, highly recomended!”
Reviews.Author: Catmatix
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was outstanding. From what I have read, it depends on your room. My wife and I had a Jr. Suit. Two french doors overlooking Damrak. Very high ceilings, very large room by euro standards. I mean offense to the euros, but space can be a premium there. The restaurant was fabulous!!!! Service excellent. I would be very happy to stay there again, and probably will. Excellent location. Cat

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Marploug
Reviews.Content: Never been in Amsterdam before. Picked this hotel because it was near Dam Square (main square) and on the Damrak. It was opposite a lovely stone building which was in fact a department store! Minutes from Dam Square with Madame Toussauds and the "red light district" was about 5 minutes away through the square - worth a wonder through to see. Hotel room was spotless and the food in the beautifully decorated restaurant was excellent. Hotel was about a 5 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station where you get the train to and from the Airport. Also where you pict up the canal tour boat - really handy for everything. Lots of restaurants about and the department store is worth a look if you want some retail therapy. Would highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: catmorri
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my mother ,cousin and aunt. We had small but very clean rooms and linen with the best beds ive had in a hotel. Bathroom small but good with usuall free toiletries. Staff were very friendly and helpful especially the maid service. This hotel is very central. Breakfast is good and typical of what you would expect in Amsterdam. Will stay here again without a doubt and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dambusters
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending wedding anniversary/christmas. Had 2 flights cancelled so arrived at hotel a day late...fantastic staff couldn't have helped more. We extended a night and they didn't charged for the missed night. Also upgraded us to a suite and placed flowers in the room . Very clean room, great minibar regularly stocked. We enjoyed the breakfast. We stay in the Dam 3-4 times a year and would definately stay at this hotel again. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in heart of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Jools9999
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Roode Leeuw in Amsterdam to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday. Got a really good deal inlcuding breakfast and I sent the hotel an email asking for a nice quiet, non smoking room, preferably with a nice view as it was for my boyfriend's 40th and they went further than that and upgraded us to a junior suite which was fantastic. We had a balcony that overlooked Damrak and we could even see quite a bit of Dam Square as well. Everything looked very festive and the room was huge! This was the start of a fabulous weekend in Amsterdam and we loved every minute of it which was helped by the fact we had such a good base to work from. All the staff were very friendly, the hotel was spotless. Probably the only downside was the breakfast. Luckily it was included in the deal we got otherwise I would not have been happy. It's literally your standard continental breakfast with a couple of hot things, I don't think it is worth the 16 euro they charge for it. On the 2nd day we didn't even bother (even though it was included!) and we ended up going down the road for something decent to eat to set us up for the day! All in all a fab trip to Amsterdam, usual places a must like red light district (not as sleazy as you think, it actually looks quite pretty at night!). Liedesplein very pretty at this time of year and they even have a mini ice skating rink at the moment. If we ever ended up going back to Amsterdam then we would definitely go back to the Roode Leeuw (although I think we may have been spoilt with the upgrade to junior suite!).

Reviews.Title: “luvly staff”
Reviews.Author: CahirBuddy
Reviews.Content: just back from amsterdam and what a beautiful city it is.would defo stay at this hotel again.was with my girlfriend and 2 year old child and couldnt have been made more welcome by the staff.relly friendly and always with a smile on their face.we could learn so much from how they live,brillant attitude to life.heiniken brewery defo mus c,coffee shops good,rest of shops good,canal cruise good,red light disrict weird and anne frnks house good.only bad point was taxi driver robbed us by charging 68 euros for a fare that was 44 on way back.so if u du choose 2 get a taxi ask price or make sure u c a meter.other than that minor blip cant wait 2 go back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DLTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel in a fantastic location very close to the main square on the main street and in easy walking distance to most places. All staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We received a room upgrade as we were travelling on our honeymoon and the suite we were in was just amazing. We found the breakfast buffet really good and the few other meals we had in the restaurant were great as well. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: spongebobs_girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights on a business trip and I have to say this hotel made an otherwise awful trip a more bearable one! Like some people have said, the rooms are small but ideal for one person. They are very clean and serviced everyday. I made good use of my room whilst staying here, the room enabled me to have some â€˜meâ€™ time during a very long tradeshow in the city. (the shower was amazing!) The room had a very well stocked mini bar and a room service menu which again I made good use of. The food arrived with 15 minutes and it was lovely! The food in the restaurant of the hotel was again really lovely and quite reasonably priced. I heard a few people in my party complain about the breakfast, powdery scrambled eggs, no fried eggs etc. I however thought the breakfast was great, selection of hot and cold to suit everyone. Lastly I have to say the staff where brilliant, very friendly and willing to do anything. Location wise, it doesnâ€™t get any better than this, itâ€™s located right on the edge of Dam Square, thereâ€™s a tram stop literally outside the hotel and all the bars and restaurants you could ever wish for! All in all, I thought the hotel was brilliant and will go back there for a personal trip sometime next year.

Reviews.Title: “Top floor at the Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: JK68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of a barge tour coming from Brugge. We were early and could not get into our room for hours, some members of the group waited till 4 o'clock. Not all rooms are non-smoking which was part of the holdup. We were lucky and got one of the 2 rooftop rooms, view of sky (and air conditioners) though it was up 13 steep steps. It was very roomy and had a very large bathroom, newly redone ....but it did have the odd hair dryer. It was very clean, and very quiet "up there". The location was wonderful, breakfast was good, the staff was pleasant and helpful. It was great to be in such a central location. We do not know what we paid as it was included. But the extension to the tour was pricey and we moved to Aaron's B&B (see my review) for our last 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “great food”
Reviews.Author: Ali-Gellatly
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i booked the hotel on expedia based on the hotels website and other reviews on this site. It was as i was expecting in terms of location and rooms. yes they are small but one look at the outside of the building and you can see why, the old design has left very little room for large rooms without changing the entire lhotel . they were actually fine for what we wanted; clean, comfortable, bright and quiet. despite the fanatstic location on the dam the rooms were silent unless you opened the windows. our room was on the second floor facing the department store on the corner of the dam-tip=a great place for lunch or breakfast is the stores own cafe on the 4th floor which overlooks the hotel-our room had a small balcony with full size patio doors which was great to look out over the crowds and take in the sights and sounds (and smells) of Amsterdam. the airconditioning was a great help too as it was quite humid at night when we were there. the shower room is also small and quite dated in style but there was a notice in the reception saying they were updating these so that is not a long term problem. the restaurant was fantastic-we ate here on the first and last night of our stay. the food was so much better than you could imagine for the cost- a two course with drinks cost us 65 euro total-and believe me for this food and service quality you would be way over 100 GBP for anything close. mixed in with the very welcoming staff who were polite, friendly and helpful at all times,( we arrived at around 9 am and expected to just leave our bags with the hotel till check in, the receptionist first checked to see if we could get a room there and then and as one was ready we were able to check in straight away, by the time we had confirmed our details and reached our room the bags were already in and we could start our holiday by 9.30 am!) -the whole experince was a very good one and would recommend this hotel. A couple tips for Amsterdam -use the train to and from the airport-fast, clean, and cheap -for the Ann Frankhuis go early or late as groups of school kids during the day can make for long queues For rainy days -visit the heineken experience-free drink and gift included in the entry fee of just 11 euros -also worth a view is the Amsterdam dungeon and madame tussaud.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: fluffyclee
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very smart and in a perfect location, Rooms where pleasant and clean. Would reconmmend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff we've found in large hotel”
Reviews.Author: dodgema
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 nights as part of a group tour, but our time here was mainly on our own. Yes, the rooms are small, and the streets outside are uncomfortably crowded. But most rooms in central cities are small and this was esp. well thought-out and clean. The bathroom was full size. The hotel is just steps from the "Dam," the center of the city, so a perfect spot for sightseeing. Also, perfect for catching the train for a day of birdwatching in the Oostvaarderplassen with Flevo Birdwatching. The dining room is very nice and the breakfasts were esp. enjoyable. But the best part was the staff, who spoke perfect English and could not have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt be more central”
Reviews.Author: janeteg
Reviews.Content: brilliant hotel great location everything within walking distance. rooms a bit on the small side but who stays in the room all day anyway. my husband doesnt like quilts but he was impressed by the ones here. he also said the pillows were the most comfortable hes ever had in a hotel. breakfast was brilliant, didnt need to eat lunch. staff were helpful and polite. the only negative were the toilet rolls, bit on the hard side. do go to gauchos argentinian steakhouse on damraat, best steak ever, the chicken was good too. also find your way to the hard rock cafe, near leidseplein wonderful food, lovely staff and if you like rock music you cant beat it. another good trip is the heineken museum.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are So Small! Stay Somewhere Else.....”
Reviews.Author: trishDerwood
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Hotel Amsterdam for a 5 night stay in April, 2007. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we wanted to stay in the City Centre area which makes it convenient for sight seeing and accessing the train station and tram system. When we arrived at the hotel, the lobby was very small but neatly decorated. The front desk personnel were polite. When we checked in, our room was about the size of a walk-in closet! This may be a SLIGHT exageration, however, there was no place in the room to set my suitcase down and not trip on it when moving about the room. When we walked in the shower room(no bathtub), the room was so narrow that if you turned around suddenly, you would wipe out half of the contents on the sink counter. There is no way an obese person could enter the bathroom and navigate it if staying in this room. We thought about complaining to management to get another room, however, I decided most of the rooms in this hotel were this size. On the plus side, the room was clean which is why I rated this hotel a "2" rather than a "1". However, there are a lot of other hotels in Amsterdam City Centre that I would look to stay at before considering staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: sergio2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights in early April 2007. The main feature of the hotel is the location, you can't get more central than this in Amsterdam (you are within walking distance of all tourist attractions of the city centre). As other users have commented, the rooms are small and mine was no exception, although it had a window (which some of the other rooms apparently lack). There was air-conditioning (remote controlled individual split-cycle unit in the room, which was however not working quite evenly, and sometimes the room would change temperature suddenly without changes having been made to the air-conditioner. The place was spotless, and Internet access is available in the room at extra cost per 24 hours (using my own laptop; apparently the flat-panel TV in the room also has Internet capability). I would stay here again, mainly because it is close to everything and the hotel is in good shape and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jallis
Reviews.Content: The room was clean - we requested two single beds and they were pushed together with very little room to separate them. The location was awesome, right new the Jordaan and the red light district. easy walking distance to Central Station for metros and water taxis. The sign at the front desk indicated that anyone caught using drugs onthe premises would be prosecuted immediately and the police would be called. I thought that was interesting. The hair dryer in the room was definitely from the 1950s - you had to be a little on the tall side to manage it since it was a hose that came out of a box on the wall. To activate it, you had to manually lift up the end of the hose that attached to the wall. A little funky but it worked, slowly. All in all, cool place to stay because of the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but exensive weekend”
Reviews.Author: melodycoolNottsUk
Reviews.Content: about 10 minutes walk from the station, which is the best way to get from the airport and much much cheaper, go out of the station and its straight down the damrak on your right hand side, u can check in your bags but not check in till 3pm, check out is 11am. quite freindly staff, the rooms are small, ours had a good back street veiw, but our freinds got a wall and their room was double booked and were walked in on whilst in bed, no apology was given by staff! we had a good shower, but very small bathroom with no bath, but our freinds did have a bath. we got a double bed with 2 single mattresses! who likes to slip down the gap??? not me. there was a mini bar, but we dare not touch it for fear of crazy prices. breakfast was 8-10 not worth the bother, scrammbled egg, bacon, make your own toast, ceral, croissants, bannana, apple or yogurt , not imprerssive at all ...slow service for tea and coffee and wanted to charge me for decaff coffee 2 euro. i must say the luggage was well cared for before and after check out. theres a free safe in your room, but the wardrobe space is redicoulously small. the aircon/heating is either too hot or too cold too. tv was mostly english but expensive for adult channels. now about amsterdam : its large with impressive buildings, lots of bikes, trams and ppl. u must go to the rembrant museum its excellent at 10 euro each, near to vondel park which is worth a walk through. a round of 4 drinks can cost u between 15 to 25 euro so beware, nearer to damm square or redlight district u are the more expensive they are. it was really quite chilly and rained for half the time we were there ....u really do need good walking legs and comfy shoes i cant stress this enough. we went on a canal trip, its ok but not much exciting info given on it, oh what lovely gable ends! LOL the red light area is ok on the main streets but very seedy on the side streets, its whatever u prefer to be honest. many sex clubs at 25 euro each but they are hard core and apprentley look like they are bored doing the deed, so i hear. the sex shops are excellent and not at all embarrissing, theres lots of bars cafes etc, but the mcdonalds have bad service. most toilets are down steep staricases, be careful after having a skinful, and u gotta pay between 20 to 50 cents for the priveldge, even in mcdonalds. get to the airport early as its very big and the gates are quite a good walking distance......btw : i never saw a windmill ... coffee shops dont sell coffee, they sell dope, if u want coffee u need a tea shop ...the smell is very off putting as u walk by .....all in all a good weekend but exepnsive, the hotel was ok, excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Not Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Sez2802
Reviews.Content: Just returned with friends and we could not check into this hotel as it was fully booked. They were not impressed at all and think we had a lucky escape when we saw their rooms! Not good value for money at all - not a 4* hotel. More like a 2/3*. Only thing going for it was the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small rooms”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location at the Dam Square. Internet service is available in the rooms but is very expensive at â‚¬25 per day. However, the hotel has a package where you can get Internet and unlimted in-room movies for â‚¬27.50 per day. My room was very tiny. Literally 7 feet by 13 feet. It was fine for one person but definitely the smallest room I have ever stayed in. Housekeeping service was excellent and the room was clean and functional. One of the nice things about this hotel is its no-marijuana policy so you do not smell the smoke like in other Amsterdam hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.............!”
Reviews.Author: horseybreeze
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the Internet as we had already won the free flights. I had never been to Amsterdam before so wasn't really sure location wise what I was booking. As it happened, this hotel couldn't be in a better location, right on the corner of Dam Square and Damrak, the main road to the station and for restaurants. It was fantastic. We had a room on the 4th floor with juliet balconies on the windows overlooking Dam Square, couldn't have asked for better. The staff were very, very helpful and even when we requested a late check out, they sorted it no problem with no charge, even though it stated in the hotel guide an extra charge would be made. The rooms were quite small but more than adequate for a long weekend. The air-con was somewhat efficient, but as the weather was boiling outside, was quite welcome! The beds were very comfy and the bathroom was more than good enough. The hotel didn't have a bar, although there was a public restaurant downstairs, the food looked quite expensive. We used the minibar for any drinks/snacks we wanted, wasn't too expensive like the rest of Amsterdam, 3eur for a beer for example. Amsterdam itself is a fantastic place, with more than enough to see and do. We took a trip round the canals and went to various odd museums you won't find anywhere else. The red light district is also a must see!! There are 300 'coffee shops' around, so the place has a very distinct smell wherever go!!! The best place we found was The Grasshopper and 2 min walk from the hotel with a bar upstairs and a coffee shop downstairs and had a wonderful outside terrace where you could drink or smoke or do both if required!!!! I can't wait to go back and would definately stay at the same hotel again and would recommend it to anyone. Everyone is so friendly

Reviews.Title: “a bit pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: mj1870
Reviews.Content: Saw this hotel available on ratestogo for 285 euros for two nights at hotel. i paid 30 euros deposit on the net and was due to pay 255 euros on arrival. you could imagine my surprise when the guy on reception said he wanted 400 euros off me. he said the 30 euros i had paid was deposit for the booking company . THE CHEEK. It was only when i refused to pay that he gave me the room at the price i had been given. Once i got in the room it was small so i thought it was pricey really and i didnt even think about using phone or restaurant due to extortionate prices. Location was second to none but overall very pricey

Reviews.Title: “Great, can;t relaly fault the place”
Reviews.Author: Bucks'75
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault this hotel. Only a 5 minute walk from Central Station, and right on the door step of Dam square. The hotel was clean, and quiet from the hussle and bustle of the street outside. We got upgraded to a superior room from a standard, which as far as I can gather just meant we had 2 chairs and a table extra. The only disappointing bit about the room was the bed was 2 singles pushed together. We didn't eat at all in the hotel as we were room only, but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area that can fulfill any budget or food requirement. Would I recommend this hotel ? Yes I would. The location is very central with some fantastic buildings surrounding it. I don't think the hotel tries to oversell itself, its just clean, comfortable and got a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Harvey871
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fantastic, rooms are small but you will find this anywhere in central Amsterdam. It's right at the Dam square end of Damrak which means all the local sites are a quick stroll away. Breakfast, service, cleaniness, amenities all cannot be faulted. Would recommend. Check the view I had from my room!

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Desirees
Reviews.Content: I had booked 3 rooms via Priceline, and had then contacted the hotel directly asking if I could have the rooms close together. Rene Wildeman replied immediately and the reservations department got back to me letting me know they would try to put us together, and then offered us an upgrade for $31 per night per room. We accepted it, and was glad we did since I saw a regular room later on and it was tiny. I am pretty sure our luggage would not fit in there. We took the train from Schipol to Central Station and then walked the straight road to the hotel. It was about 7 mins away. Check in was prompt, the desk people were very friendly and the rooms were ok. They were dark since they were in the back with no view at all but the size of the rooms were amazing. I did not like the toiletries that came with the hotel however. The shampoo felt like watered down laundry detergent. I would recommend taking your own supply. Also, a warning, be careful of what you sign up for as wireless internet. We were told to open the internet page and follow instructions to sign up for internet. Well, we turned on my laptop and Tmobile came up. So we signed up for it, and lost signal right after that. Turns out that was not what the hotel offered. So, I will now have to dispute those charges since the connection was bad and I did not get access at all except for the first few mins it needed the credit card number. The beds were very comfortable, the toilet paper felt like sandpaper :) The location was unbeatable. It was in the middle of the tourist section. After I saw where the Crowne Plaza and Marriott was located, I was glad I won the Red Leeow bid, since we like being in the center of touristy things and this was it. The RDL was literally a block away, we could be there in about 5 mins. Loved Extase coffee shop, people in Amsterdam were so so friendly I cant begin to say enough! Remember to buy water from the supermarket near Madame Tussauds, much cheaper than anywhere else. We were charged city taxes of 5.66 euros per night per room. Room service was quick and efficient. Only once did we come back and see that housekeeping had kept a bag of trash on the bathroom sink and had forgotten to remove it, however someone came up in seconds after I called the front desk and had it cleared and kept on aplogizing. There was an electric kettle in the rooms with cups, coffees, teas, sugar and creamer. The only thing I did not like was the absence of an iron in the room. I was told we would need to go to the ironing room on the third floor to iron...which felt wierd. We also asked if we could keep one room till about 1pm and check out from the other two rooms since our flight was at 5pm and we were planning to leave the hotel around 2pm. The desk agent was very quick to say "no" and it was abrupt, if the other agents had not been nice I would have had a problem with it. Anyway, it was a good hotel, not to be compared to a 4 star in the US but good...I would recommend the hotel but remember it might be a good idea to take the upgrade if offered and it is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ramshaw
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very handy for Central Station , Dam Square , Canals and Damrak. It has been recently refurbished our room and furnishings were very clean. The individual air conditioning and double glazing were a real bonus as we were there during the heat wave in mid July. Staff were very courteous, and being late risers we enjoyed breakfasts in our room. We found that the continental breakfasts were more than adequate, but there was the option of additional cooked breakfast for about 3 euros extra each. The main restaurant serves a good selection of traditional Dutch meals in the evenings.Recommend this hotel for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After being bumped from the hd Doolen hotel on a lovely canel in Amsterdam we were, I feel, tricked into accepting a room in the Amsterdam "Red Lion" hotel (located in the DAM right next to a noisy, smelly McDonalds). When it was time to leave, we bought our tickets for the Shuttle (there's a sign in the lobby that states "we pick up at this hotel") after purchasing the tickets at 10:15 am (our flight was at 23:00) we asked if the shuttle would pull up in front, we were told yes. That was not true, as the shuttle picks up across the DAM. Because of the ill communication and simply poor customer service we received at the hotel we missed our flight and ended up spending another $139.00+ euros (about $195.00 dollars) finding another hotel for the night. Even though this hotel is rated a 4 star, it's obviously for people who don't make it a habit to stay in better places. If you don't care about service and reliability pick this place, If you do -- run as fast as you can to another one. I also find it very interesting that I con't find a customer service link to complain and ask for restitution.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Amsterdam. The location is very good as you are close to all the sites and the train station. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly but the rooms were a little grubby and the frosted glass door on the bathroom was strange to say the least. The rooms were a bit noisy as you could hear people in the hall and doors closing; the walls were paper thin, we could hear someone cough in the next room! The room was a little on the small side. The hotel restaurant was very good, the food was reasonably priced, very good and the waiter was great. The staff belonged in a 4 star hotel, which this is most certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location makes up for an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Red Lion for a weekend get away. We flew in and took the train to Centraal Station and walked to the hotel. Even though it was freezing in Amsterdam the walk was quick and the hotel was very easy to find. The hotel is located right next to Dam Square and the tram stops directly in front of the hotel. This made for easy access to any part of the city! It also made it easy to wander around and still find your way back since it is located on Dam Square. The Hotel itself was ok. We were upgraded to a Jr suite for an extra â‚¬20 a night. I would not recommend this. The room we were in was a conference room with a Murphy bed and ceiling to floor windows looking out onto a brick wall and A/C unit for the building. The staff were helpful. Not out going but not rude. We did not eat at the Restaurant so I can't review on that. But based on the price and the location I will definitely stay in the hotel again while in Amsterdam. The reason for the 4 rating on this review is the fact that our suite was a conference room complete with projector screen and extra office chairs. I would not recommend upgrading to a jr suite. They also charge for EVERYTHING in the room! So if you need your tea, like me, I suggest bringing some along!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: CajunWave
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel courtesy of Priceline. Was a bit apprehensive at first because of its Damrak location (noisy) and the fact that I couldn't find a lot of information online. I had no need to worry. I arrived very early (7am) and expected to be told "check in is at 3" but the front desk clerk smiled, welcomed me and proceeded to check me in to room 422. It is a nice (but small) double room in the back of the hotel and was VERY quiet. The room featured a flat-screen TV, minibar, online internet, etc. as well as a small but efficient marble bathroom. Security was very good in the hotel as you must have a room key to use the elevators or get into the main stairwell. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel. Did not eat in the restaurant but it was crowded throughout my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel! Don't pay full price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel regularly for business and leisure, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. As long as you get a good deal on the price, you can't go wrong. It's location is perfect - right on Dam Square, seconds away from the Royal Palace, Madame Tussaud's (which I also recommend), museums, tours, shopping, restaurants, and the infamous Red Light District. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. I would advise that if you plan on sleeping in in the mornings, don't forget to put out the "Do not Disturb" sign as the cleaning staff are up early and very persistent. The hotel had a few english speaking TV news and entertainment channels available, and the TV was a nifty little flatscreen. The choice of movies was fairly good too. Only negative point: The room was small. We only saw the standard (or "comfortable") room, so I don't know how much bigger the "superior" rooms were. If you get the choice, ask for a room with a bath as the bathroom will be bigger and the shower is attached anyway. The "double" bed was two single beds pushed together, and the only other things that could fit in the room were a desk and a chair. But that aside, the room was clean, not completely out-dated, reasonably quiet, and perfect for falling asleep in after a big day out. We booked the room online for around Â£60 ($100USD) per night. This was about half the average price quoted on this site at the time, and way way way below the price on their web site. So considering the excellent location, staff, and price, the size of the room was easy to overlook. If you do get a good deal on this hotel, and you are prepared for the room to be small, you will absolutely not be disappointed. I would definitely stay here again. A few helpful tips: #1. The English name for the hotel is "The Red Lion". I found it was easier to say this than pronounce the Dutch name. #2. There is a shuttle bus from the airport. It costs 12 euro per person and drops you off across the square from the hotel. A taxi is about 35 euro (but be careful because the taxi drivers in Amsterdam will try to con you). The train to Central Station is only around 4 euro and it is about a 15-20 minute walk up the main street to the hotel. A cheap option if you have very little baggage. #3. Breakfast at the hotel is 11 euro. That sounds expensive, but that's what you'll end up paying in a similar setting elsewhere in the area. However, the restaurant is very, very smokey, and the food isn't that great. I advise exploring the neighbourhood for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sound_Diva
Reviews.Content: We booked a package (no longer available) for the Hotel Amsterdam and with all the freebies and perks, it actually worked out to less Euros than some of the other 4 star hotels. We had a junior suite which was huge, as well as a large bathroom with tub and shower. Package included buffet breakfast each morning, a free canal boat cruise and two tickets to the Van Gogh Museum. Staff was friendly and great at providing information and suggestions. Our suite was right on Damrak, but the windows are truly soundproof. Comfortable bed and big-screen TV. Unfortunately, we probably won't get to stay here next time, as it is really pricey without all the items included in the package. But if your budget allows it, you will probably like this hotel. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Amsterdam on a mid-week break. We booked the 'Red Lion Package' and received excellent value for the money we paid. The room was large and spacious and very comfortable with a king size bed and sitting area. The buffet breakfast was good and included in the package price. One evening meal was included also in the package and the choices were from the usual menu not a cheap limited selection as one often finds with 'deals'. The food was excellent so we actually decided to return again the following evening. The only criticism was that we forgot our travel adaptor so borrowed one for a 'small' charge from reception. The small charge was 10 euros on the final bill!! All in all a good trip and would certainly return again.
